64  static void __cpuid(int* cpuid_data, int info_type)
65  {
66  __asm {
67  push ebx
68  push edi
69  mov edi, cpuid_data
70  mov eax, info_type
71  cpuid
72  mov [edi], eax
73  mov [edi + 4], ebx
74  mov [edi + 8], ecx
75  mov [edi + 12], edx
76  pop edi
77  pop ebx
78  }
79  }
80  __int64 __rdtsc()
81  {
82  LARGE_INTEGER li;
83  __asm {
84  rdtsc
85  mov li.LowPart, eax
86  mov li.HighPart, edx
87  }
88  return li.QuadPart;
89  }
90 #else
91  static void __cpuid(int* cpuid_data, int) {
92  cpuid_data[0] = 0x00000000;
93  cpuid_data[1] = 0x00000000;
94  cpuid_data[2] = 0x00000000;
95  cpuid_data[3] = 0x00000000;
96  }
97  __int64 __rdtsc() { return (__int64)0; }
98 #endif

105 //////////////////// Windows TFdSet ////////////////////////////////////////////////
106 class TFdSet {
107 private:
108  fd_set *fds_bits; // file descriptors (according MSDN maximum is 64)
109 public:
110  TFdSet() { fds_bits = new fd_set; fds_bits->fd_count = 0; }
111  virtual ~TFdSet() { delete fds_bits; }
112  void Copy(TFdSet &fd) const { memcpy((void*)fd.fds_bits, fds_bits, sizeof(fd_set)); }
113  TFdSet(const TFdSet& fd) { fd.Copy(*this); }
114  TFdSet& operator=(const TFdSet& fd) { fd.Copy(*this); return *this; }
115  void Zero() { fds_bits->fd_count = 0; }
116  void Set(Int_t fd)
117  {
118  if (fds_bits->fd_count < FD_SETSIZE-1) // protect out of bound access (64)
119  fds_bits->fd_array[fds_bits->fd_count++] = (SOCKET)fd;
120  else
121  ::SysError("TFdSet::Set", "fd_count will exeed FD_SETSIZE");
122  }
123  void Clr(Int_t fd)
124  {
125  int i;
126  for (i=0; i<fds_bits->fd_count; i++) {
127  if (fds_bits->fd_array[i]==(SOCKET)fd) {
128  while (i<fds_bits->fd_count-1) {
129  fds_bits->fd_array[i] = fds_bits->fd_array[i+1];
130  i++;
131  }
132  fds_bits->fd_count--;
133  break;
134  }
135  }
136  }
137  Int_t IsSet(Int_t fd) { return __WSAFDIsSet((SOCKET)fd, fds_bits); }
138  Int_t *GetBits() { return fds_bits && fds_bits->fd_count ? (Int_t*)fds_bits : 0; }
139  UInt_t GetCount() { return (UInt_t)fds_bits->fd_count; }
140  Int_t GetFd(Int_t i) { return i<fds_bits->fd_count ? fds_bits->fd_array[i] : 0; }
141 };

161  static struct signal_map {
162  int code;
163  SigHandler_t handler;
164  char *signame;
165  } signal_map[kMAXSIGNALS] = { // the order of the signals should be identical
166  -1 /*SIGBUS*/, 0, "bus error", // to the one in SysEvtHandler.h
167  SIGSEGV, 0, "segmentation violation",
168  -1 /*SIGSYS*/, 0, "bad argument to system call",
169  -1 /*SIGPIPE*/, 0, "write on a pipe with no one to read it",
170  SIGILL, 0, "illegal instruction",
171  -1 /*SIGQUIT*/, 0, "quit",
172  SIGINT, 0, "interrupt",
173  -1 /*SIGWINCH*/, 0, "window size change",
174  -1 /*SIGALRM*/, 0, "alarm clock",
175  -1 /*SIGCHLD*/, 0, "death of a child",
176  -1 /*SIGURG*/, 0, "urgent data arrived on an I/O channel",
177  SIGFPE, 0, "floating point exception",
178  SIGTERM, 0, "termination signal",
179  -1 /*SIGUSR1*/, 0, "user-defined signal 1",

185  //---- RPC -------------------------------------------------------------------
186  //*-* Error codes set by the Windows Sockets implementation are not made available
187  //*-* via the errno variable. Additionally, for the getXbyY class of functions,
188  //*-* error codes are NOT made available via the h_errno variable. Instead, error
189  //*-* codes are accessed by using the WSAGetLastError . This function is provided
190  //*-* in Windows Sockets as a precursor (and eventually an alias) for the Win32
191  //*-* function GetLastError. This is intended to provide a reliable way for a thread
192  //*-* in a multithreaded process to obtain per-thread error information.
193 
194  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
195  /// Receive exactly length bytes into buffer. Returns number of bytes
196  /// received. Returns -1 in case of error, -2 in case of MSG_OOB
197  /// and errno == EWOULDBLOCK, -3 in case of MSG_OOB and errno == EINVAL
198  /// and -4 in case of kNonBlock and errno == EWOULDBLOCK.
199  /// Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
200 
201  static int WinNTRecv(int socket, void *buffer, int length, int flag)
202  {
203  if (socket == -1) return -1;
204  SOCKET sock = socket;
205 
206  int once = 0;
207  if (flag == -1) {
208  flag = 0;
209  once = 1;
210  }
211  if (flag == MSG_PEEK) {
212  once = 1;
213  }
214 
215  int nrecv, n;
216  char *buf = (char *)buffer;
217 
218  for (n = 0; n < length; n += nrecv) {
219  if ((nrecv = ::recv(sock, buf+n, length-n, flag)) <= 0) {
220  if (nrecv == 0) {
221  break; // EOF
222  }
223  if (flag == MSG_OOB) {
224  if (::WSAGetLastError() == WSAEWOULDBLOCK) {
225  return -2;
226  } else if (::WSAGetLastError() == WSAEINVAL) {
227  return -3;
228  }
229  }
230  if (::WSAGetLastError() == WSAEWOULDBLOCK) {
231  return -4;
232  } else {
233  if (::WSAGetLastError() != WSAEINTR)
234  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTRecv", "recv");
235  if (::WSAGetLastError() == EPIPE ||
236  ::WSAGetLastError() == WSAECONNRESET)
237  return -5;
238  else
239  return -1;
240  }
241  }
242  if (once) {
243  return nrecv;
244  }
245  }
246  return n;
247  }
248 
249  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
250  /// Send exactly length bytes from buffer. Returns -1 in case of error,
251  /// otherwise number of sent bytes. Returns -4 in case of kNoBlock and
252  /// errno == EWOULDBLOCK. Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer
253  /// (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
254 
255  static int WinNTSend(int socket, const void *buffer, int length, int flag)
256  {
257  if (socket < 0) return -1;
258  SOCKET sock = socket;
259 
260  int once = 0;
261  if (flag == -1) {
262  flag = 0;
263  once = 1;
264  }
265 
266  int nsent, n;
267  const char *buf = (const char *)buffer;
268 
269  for (n = 0; n < length; n += nsent) {
270  if ((nsent = ::send(sock, buf+n, length-n, flag)) <= 0) {
271  if (nsent == 0) {
272  break;
273  }
274  if (::WSAGetLastError() == WSAEWOULDBLOCK) {
275  return -4;
276  } else {
277  if (::WSAGetLastError() != WSAEINTR)
278  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTSend", "send");
279  if (::WSAGetLastError() == EPIPE ||
280  ::WSAGetLastError() == WSAECONNRESET)
281  return -5;
282  else
283  return -1;
284  }
285  }
286  if (once) {
287  return nsent;
288  }
289  }
290  return n;
291  }
292 
293  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
294  /// Wait for events on the file descriptors specified in the readready and
295  /// writeready masks or for timeout (in milliseconds) to occur.
296 
297  static int WinNTSelect(TFdSet *readready, TFdSet *writeready, Long_t timeout)
298  {
299  int retcode;
300  fd_set* rbits = readready ? (fd_set*)readready->GetBits() : 0;
301  fd_set* wbits = writeready ? (fd_set*)writeready->GetBits() : 0;
302 
303  if (timeout >= 0) {
304  timeval tv;
305  tv.tv_sec = timeout / 1000;
306  tv.tv_usec = (timeout % 1000) * 1000;
307 
308  retcode = ::select(0, rbits, wbits, 0, &tv);
309  } else {
310  retcode = ::select(0, rbits, wbits, 0, 0);
311  }
312 
313  if (retcode == SOCKET_ERROR) {
314  int errcode = ::WSAGetLastError();
315 
316  // if file descriptor is not a socket, assume it is the pipe used
317  // by TXSocket
318  if (errcode == WSAENOTSOCK) {
319  struct __stat64 buf;
320  int result = _fstat64( readready->GetFd(0), &buf );
321  if ( result == 0 ) {
322  if (buf.st_size > 0)
323  return 1;
324  }
325  // yield execution to another thread that is ready to run
326  // if no other thread is ready, sleep 1 ms before to return
327  if (gGlobalEvent) {
328  ::WaitForSingleObject(gGlobalEvent, 1);
329  ::ResetEvent(gGlobalEvent);
330  }
331  return 0;
332  }
333 
334  if ( errcode == WSAEINTR) {
335  TSystem::ResetErrno(); // errno is not self reseting
336  return -2;
337  }
338  if (errcode == EBADF) {
339  return -3;
340  }
341  return -1;
342  }
343  return retcode;
344  }

346  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
347  /// Get shared library search path.
348 
349  static const char *DynamicPath(const char *newpath = 0, Bool_t reset = kFALSE)
350  {
351  static TString dynpath;
352 
353  if (reset || newpath) {
354  dynpath = "";
355  }
356  if (newpath) {
357 
358  dynpath = newpath;
359 
360  } else if (dynpath == "") {
361  TString rdynpath = gEnv ? gEnv->GetValue("Root.DynamicPath", (char*)0) : "";
362  rdynpath.ReplaceAll("; ", ";"); // in case DynamicPath was extended
363  if (rdynpath == "") {
364  rdynpath = ".;"; rdynpath += TROOT::GetBinDir();
365  }
366  TString path = gSystem->Getenv("PATH");
367  if (path == "")
368  dynpath = rdynpath;
369  else {
370  dynpath = path; dynpath += ";"; dynpath += rdynpath;
371  }
372 
373  }
374 
375  if (!dynpath.Contains(TROOT::GetLibDir())) {
376  dynpath += ";"; dynpath += TROOT::GetLibDir();
377  }
378 
379  return dynpath;
380  }

382  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
383  /// Call the signal handler associated with the signal.
384 
385  static void sighandler(int sig)
386  {
387  for (int i = 0; i < kMAXSIGNALS; i++) {
388  if (signal_map[i].code == sig) {
389  (*signal_map[i].handler)((ESignals)i);
390  return;
391  }
392  }
393  }
394 
395  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
396  /// Set a signal handler for a signal.
397 
398  static void WinNTSignal(ESignals sig, SigHandler_t handler)
399  {
400  signal_map[sig].handler = handler;
401  if (signal_map[sig].code != -1)
402  (SigHandler_t)signal(signal_map[sig].code, sighandler);
403  }

413  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
414  /// WinNT signal handler.
415 
416  static BOOL ConsoleSigHandler(DWORD sig)
417  {
418  switch (sig) {
419  case CTRL_C_EVENT:
420  if (gSystem) {
421  ((TWinNTSystem*)gSystem)->DispatchSignals(kSigInterrupt);
422  }
423  else {
424  Break("TInterruptHandler::Notify", "keyboard interrupt");
425  if (TROOT::Initialized()) {
426  gInterpreter->RewindDictionary();
427  }
428  }
429  return kTRUE;
430  case CTRL_BREAK_EVENT:
431  case CTRL_LOGOFF_EVENT:
432  case CTRL_SHUTDOWN_EVENT:
433  case CTRL_CLOSE_EVENT:
434  default:
435  printf("\n *** Break *** keyboard interrupt - ROOT is terminated\n");
436  gSystem->Exit(-1);
437  return kTRUE;
438  }
439  }

472  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
473  /// Message processing loop for the TGWin32 related GUI
474  /// thread for processing windows messages (aka Main/Server thread).
475  /// We need to start the thread outside the TGWin32 / GUI related
476  /// dll, because starting threads at DLL init time does not work.
477  /// Instead, we start an ideling thread at binary startup, and only
478  /// call the "real" message processing function
479  /// TGWin32::GUIThreadMessageFunc() once gVirtualX comes up.
480 
481  static DWORD WINAPI GUIThreadMessageProcessingLoop(void *p)
482  {
483  MSG msg;
484 
485  // force to create message queue
486  ::PeekMessage(&msg, NULL, WM_USER, WM_USER, PM_NOREMOVE);
487 
488  Int_t erret = 0;
489  Bool_t endLoop = kFALSE;
490  while (!endLoop) {
491  if (gGlobalEvent) ::SetEvent(gGlobalEvent);
492  erret = ::GetMessage(&msg, NULL, NULL, NULL);
493  if (erret <= 0) endLoop = kTRUE;
494  if (gGUIThreadMsgFunc)
495  endLoop = (*gGUIThreadMsgFunc)(&msg);
496  }
497 
498  gVirtualX->CloseDisplay();
499 
500  // exit thread
501  if (erret == -1) {
502  erret = ::GetLastError();
503  Error("MsgLoop", "Error in GetMessage");
504  ::ExitThread(-1);
505  } else {
506  ::ExitThread(0);
507  }
508  return 0;
509  }

511  //=========================================================================
512  // Load IMAGEHLP.DLL and get the address of functions in it that we'll use
513  // by Microsoft, from http://www.microsoft.com/msj/0597/hoodtextfigs.htm#fig1
514  //=========================================================================
515  // Make typedefs for some IMAGEHLP.DLL functions so that we can use them
516  // with GetProcAddress
517  typedef BOOL (__stdcall *SYMINITIALIZEPROC)( HANDLE, LPSTR, BOOL );
518  typedef BOOL (__stdcall *SYMCLEANUPPROC)( HANDLE );
519  typedef BOOL (__stdcall *STACKWALK64PROC)
520  ( DWORD, HANDLE, HANDLE, LPSTACKFRAME64, LPVOID,
521  PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE,PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE,
522  PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE, PTRANSLATE_ADDRESS_ROUTINE );
523  typedef LPVOID (__stdcall *SYMFUNCTIONTABLEACCESS64PROC)( HANDLE, DWORD64 );
524  typedef DWORD (__stdcall *SYMGETMODULEBASE64PROC)( HANDLE, DWORD64 );
525  typedef BOOL (__stdcall *SYMGETMODULEINFO64PROC)(HANDLE, DWORD64, PIMAGEHLP_MODULE64);
526  typedef BOOL (__stdcall *SYMGETSYMFROMADDR64PROC)( HANDLE, DWORD64, PDWORD64, PIMAGEHLP_SYMBOL64);
527  typedef BOOL (__stdcall *SYMGETLINEFROMADDR64PROC)(HANDLE, DWORD64, PDWORD, PIMAGEHLP_LINE64);
528  typedef DWORD (__stdcall *UNDECORATESYMBOLNAMEPROC)(PCSTR, PSTR, DWORD, DWORD);
529 
530 
531  static SYMINITIALIZEPROC _SymInitialize = 0;
532  static SYMCLEANUPPROC _SymCleanup = 0;
533  static STACKWALK64PROC _StackWalk64 = 0;
534  static SYMFUNCTIONTABLEACCESS64PROC _SymFunctionTableAccess64 = 0;
535  static SYMGETMODULEBASE64PROC _SymGetModuleBase64 = 0;
536  static SYMGETMODULEINFO64PROC _SymGetModuleInfo64 = 0;
537  static SYMGETSYMFROMADDR64PROC _SymGetSymFromAddr64 = 0;
538  static SYMGETLINEFROMADDR64PROC _SymGetLineFromAddr64 = 0;
539  static UNDECORATESYMBOLNAMEPROC _UnDecorateSymbolName = 0;
540 
541  BOOL InitImagehlpFunctions()
542  {
543  // Fetches function addresses from IMAGEHLP.DLL at run-time, so we
544  // don't need to link against its import library. These functions
545  // are used in StackTrace; if they cannot be found (e.g. because
546  // IMAGEHLP.DLL doesn't exist or has the wrong version) we cannot
547  // produce a stack trace.
548 
549  HMODULE hModImagehlp = LoadLibrary( "IMAGEHLP.DLL" );
550  if (!hModImagehlp)
551  return FALSE;
552 
553  _SymInitialize = (SYMINITIALIZEPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "SymInitialize" );
554  if (!_SymInitialize)
555  return FALSE;
556 
557  _SymCleanup = (SYMCLEANUPPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "SymCleanup" );
558  if (!_SymCleanup)
559  return FALSE;
560 
561  _StackWalk64 = (STACKWALK64PROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "StackWalk64" );
562  if (!_StackWalk64)
563  return FALSE;
564 
565  _SymFunctionTableAccess64 = (SYMFUNCTIONTABLEACCESS64PROC) GetProcAddress(hModImagehlp, "SymFunctionTableAccess64" );
566  if (!_SymFunctionTableAccess64)
567  return FALSE;
568 
569  _SymGetModuleBase64=(SYMGETMODULEBASE64PROC)GetProcAddress(hModImagehlp, "SymGetModuleBase64");
570  if (!_SymGetModuleBase64)
571  return FALSE;
572 
573  _SymGetModuleInfo64=(SYMGETMODULEINFO64PROC)GetProcAddress(hModImagehlp, "SymGetModuleInfo64");
574  if (!_SymGetModuleInfo64)
575  return FALSE;
576 
577  _SymGetSymFromAddr64=(SYMGETSYMFROMADDR64PROC)GetProcAddress(hModImagehlp, "SymGetSymFromAddr64");
578  if (!_SymGetSymFromAddr64)
579  return FALSE;
580 
581  _SymGetLineFromAddr64=(SYMGETLINEFROMADDR64PROC)GetProcAddress(hModImagehlp, "SymGetLineFromAddr64");
582  if (!_SymGetLineFromAddr64)
583  return FALSE;
584 
585  _UnDecorateSymbolName=(UNDECORATESYMBOLNAMEPROC)GetProcAddress(hModImagehlp, "UnDecorateSymbolName");
586  if (!_UnDecorateSymbolName)
587  return FALSE;
588 
589  if (!_SymInitialize(GetCurrentProcess(), 0, TRUE ))
590  return FALSE;
591 
592  return TRUE;
593  }

595  // stack trace helpers getModuleName, getFunctionName by
596  /**************************************************************************
597  * VRS - The Virtual Rendering System
598  * Copyright (C) 2000-2004 Computer Graphics Systems Group at the
599  * Hasso-Plattner-Institute (HPI), Potsdam, Germany.
600  * This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
601  * under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
602  * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2.1 of the License, or
603  * (at your option) any later version.
604  ***************************************************************************/
605  std::string GetModuleName(DWORD64 address)
606  {
607  // Return the name of the module that contains the function at address.
608  // Used by StackTrace.
609  std::ostringstream out;
610  HANDLE process = ::GetCurrentProcess();
611 
612  DWORD lineDisplacement = 0;
613  IMAGEHLP_LINE64 line;
614  ::ZeroMemory(&line, sizeof(line));
615  line.SizeOfStruct = sizeof(line);
616  if(_SymGetLineFromAddr64(process, address, &lineDisplacement, &line)) {
617  out << line.FileName << "(" << line.LineNumber << "): ";
618  } else {
619  IMAGEHLP_MODULE64 module;
620  ::ZeroMemory(&module, sizeof(module));
621  module.SizeOfStruct = sizeof(module);
622  if(_SymGetModuleInfo64(process, address, &module)) {
623  out << module.ModuleName << "!";
624  } else {
625  out << "0x" << std::hex << address << std::dec << " ";
626  }
627  }
628 
629  return out.str();
630  }
631 
632  std::string GetFunctionName(DWORD64 address)
633  {
634  // Return the name of the function at address.
635  // Used by StackTrace.
636  DWORD64 symbolDisplacement = 0;
637  HANDLE process = ::GetCurrentProcess();
638 
639  const unsigned int SYMBOL_BUFFER_SIZE = 8192;
640  char symbolBuffer[SYMBOL_BUFFER_SIZE];
641  PIMAGEHLP_SYMBOL64 symbol = reinterpret_cast<PIMAGEHLP_SYMBOL64>(symbolBuffer);
642  ::ZeroMemory(symbol, SYMBOL_BUFFER_SIZE);
643  symbol->SizeOfStruct = SYMBOL_BUFFER_SIZE;
644  symbol->MaxNameLength = SYMBOL_BUFFER_SIZE - sizeof(IMAGEHLP_SYMBOL64);
645 
646  if(_SymGetSymFromAddr64(process, address, &symbolDisplacement, symbol)) {
647  // Make the symbol readable for humans
648  const unsigned int NAME_SIZE = 8192;
649  char name[NAME_SIZE];
650  _UnDecorateSymbolName(
651  symbol->Name,
652  name,
653  NAME_SIZE,
654  UNDNAME_COMPLETE |
655  UNDNAME_NO_THISTYPE |
656  UNDNAME_NO_SPECIAL_SYMS |
657  UNDNAME_NO_MEMBER_TYPE |
658  UNDNAME_NO_MS_KEYWORDS |
659  UNDNAME_NO_ACCESS_SPECIFIERS
660  );
661 
662  std::string result;
663  result += name;
664  result += "()";
665  return result;
666  } else {
667  return "??";
668  }
669  }
670 
671  ////// Shortcuts helper functions IsShortcut and ResolveShortCut ///////////
672 
673  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
674  /// Validates if a file name has extension '.lnk'. Returns true if file
675  /// name have extension same as Window's shortcut file (.lnk).
676 
677  static BOOL IsShortcut(const char *filename)
678  {
679  //File extension for the Window's shortcuts (.lnk)
680  const char *extLnk = ".lnk";
681  if (filename != NULL) {
682  //Validate extension
683  TString strfilename(filename);
684  if (strfilename.EndsWith(extLnk))
685  return TRUE;
686  }
687  return FALSE;
688  }
689 
690  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
691  /// Resolve a ShellLink (i.e. c:\path\shortcut.lnk) to a real path.
692 
693  static BOOL ResolveShortCut(LPCSTR pszShortcutFile, char *pszPath, int maxbuf)
694  {
695  HRESULT hres;
696  IShellLink* psl;
697  char szGotPath[MAX_PATH];
698  WIN32_FIND_DATA wfd;
699 
700  *pszPath = 0; // assume failure
701 
702  // Make typedefs for some ole32.dll functions so that we can use them
703  // with GetProcAddress
704  typedef HRESULT (__stdcall *COINITIALIZEPROC)( LPVOID );
705  static COINITIALIZEPROC _CoInitialize = 0;
706  typedef void (__stdcall *COUNINITIALIZEPROC)( void );
707  static COUNINITIALIZEPROC _CoUninitialize = 0;
708  typedef HRESULT (__stdcall *COCREATEINSTANCEPROC)( REFCLSID, LPUNKNOWN,
709  DWORD, REFIID, LPVOID );
710  static COCREATEINSTANCEPROC _CoCreateInstance = 0;
711 
712  HMODULE hModImagehlp = LoadLibrary( "ole32.dll" );
713  if (!hModImagehlp)
714  return FALSE;
715 
716  _CoInitialize = (COINITIALIZEPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CoInitialize" );
717  if (!_CoInitialize)
718  return FALSE;
719  _CoUninitialize = (COUNINITIALIZEPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CoUninitialize");
720  if (!_CoUninitialize)
721  return FALSE;
722  _CoCreateInstance = (COCREATEINSTANCEPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CoCreateInstance" );
723  if (!_CoCreateInstance)
724  return FALSE;
725 
726  _CoInitialize(NULL);
727 
728  hres = _CoCreateInstance(CLSID_ShellLink, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
729  IID_IShellLink, (void **) &psl);
730  if (SUCCEEDED(hres)) {
731  IPersistFile* ppf;
732 
733  hres = psl->QueryInterface(IID_IPersistFile, (void **) &ppf);
734  if (SUCCEEDED(hres)) {
735  WCHAR wsz[MAX_PATH];
736  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, pszShortcutFile, -1, wsz, MAX_PATH);
737 
738  hres = ppf->Load(wsz, STGM_READ);
739  if (SUCCEEDED(hres)) {
740  hres = psl->Resolve(HWND_DESKTOP, SLR_ANY_MATCH | SLR_NO_UI | SLR_UPDATE);
741  if (SUCCEEDED(hres)) {
742  strlcpy(szGotPath, pszShortcutFile,MAX_PATH);
743  hres = psl->GetPath(szGotPath, MAX_PATH, (WIN32_FIND_DATA *)&wfd,
744  SLGP_UNCPRIORITY | SLGP_RAWPATH);
745  strlcpy(pszPath,szGotPath, maxbuf);
746  if (maxbuf) pszPath[maxbuf-1] = 0;
747  }
748  }
749  ppf->Release();
750  }
751  psl->Release();
752  }
753  _CoUninitialize();
754 
755  return SUCCEEDED(hres);
756  }
757 
758  void UpdateRegistry(TWinNTSystem* sys, char* buf /* size of buffer: MAX_MODULE_NAME32 + 1 */) {
759  // register ROOT as the .root file handler:
760  GetModuleFileName(0, buf, MAX_MODULE_NAME32 + 1);
761  if (strcmp(sys->TWinNTSystem::BaseName(buf), "root.exe"))
762  return;
763  HKEY regCUS;
764  if (!::RegOpenKeyEx(HKEY_CURRENT_USER, "Software", 0, KEY_READ, &regCUS) == ERROR_SUCCESS)
765  return;
766  HKEY regCUSC;
767  if (!::RegOpenKeyEx(regCUS, "Classes", 0, KEY_READ, &regCUSC) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
768  ::RegCloseKey(regCUS);
769  return;
770  }
771 
772  HKEY regROOT;
773  bool regROOTwrite = false;
774  TString iconloc(buf);
775  iconloc += ",-101";
776 
777  if (::RegOpenKeyEx(regCUSC, "ROOTDEV.ROOT", 0, KEY_READ, &regROOT) != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
778  ::RegCloseKey(regCUSC);
779  if (::RegOpenKeyEx(regCUS, "Classes", 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE, &regCUSC) == ERROR_SUCCESS &&
780  ::RegCreateKeyEx(regCUSC, "ROOTDEV.ROOT", 0, NULL, 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE,
781  NULL, &regROOT, NULL) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
782  regROOTwrite = true;
783  }
784  } else {
785  HKEY regROOTIcon;
786  if (::RegOpenKeyEx(regROOT, "DefaultIcon", 0, KEY_READ, &regROOTIcon) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
787  char bufIconLoc[1024];
788  DWORD dwType;
789  DWORD dwSize = sizeof(bufIconLoc);
790 
791  if (::RegQueryValueEx(regROOTIcon, NULL, NULL, &dwType, (BYTE*)bufIconLoc, &dwSize) == ERROR_SUCCESS)
792  regROOTwrite = (iconloc != bufIconLoc);
793  else
794  regROOTwrite = true;
795  ::RegCloseKey(regROOTIcon);
796  } else
797  regROOTwrite = true;
798  if (regROOTwrite) {
799  // re-open for writing
800  ::RegCloseKey(regCUSC);
801  ::RegCloseKey(regROOT);
802  if (::RegOpenKeyEx(regCUS, "Classes", 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE, &regCUSC) != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
803  // error opening key for writing:
804  regROOTwrite = false;
805  } else {
806  if (::RegOpenKeyEx(regCUSC, "ROOTDEV.ROOT", 0, KEY_WRITE, &regROOT) != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
807  // error opening key for writing:
808  regROOTwrite = false;
809  ::RegCloseKey(regCUSC);
810  }
811  }
812  }
813  }
814 
815  // determine the fileopen.C file path:
816  TString fileopen = "fileopen.C";
817  TString rootmacrodir = "macros";
818  sys->PrependPathName(getenv("ROOTSYS"), rootmacrodir);
819  sys->PrependPathName(rootmacrodir.Data(), fileopen);
820 
821  if (regROOTwrite) {
822  // only write to registry if fileopen.C is readable
823  regROOTwrite = (::_access(fileopen, kReadPermission) == 0);
824  }
825 
826  if (!regROOTwrite) {
827  ::RegCloseKey(regROOT);
828  ::RegCloseKey(regCUSC);
829  ::RegCloseKey(regCUS);
830  return;
831  }
832 
833  static const char apptitle[] = "ROOT data file";
834  ::RegSetValueEx(regROOT, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)apptitle, sizeof(apptitle));
835  DWORD editflags = /*FTA_OpenIsSafe*/ 0x00010000; // trust downloaded files
836  ::RegSetValueEx(regROOT, "EditFlags", 0, REG_DWORD, (BYTE*)&editflags, sizeof(editflags));
837 
838  HKEY regROOTIcon;
839  if (::RegCreateKeyEx(regROOT, "DefaultIcon", 0, NULL, 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE,
840  NULL, &regROOTIcon, NULL) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
841  TString iconloc(buf);
842  iconloc += ",-101";
843  ::RegSetValueEx(regROOTIcon, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)iconloc.Data(), iconloc.Length() + 1);
844  ::RegCloseKey(regROOTIcon);
845  }
846 
847  // "open" verb
848  HKEY regROOTshell;
849  if (::RegCreateKeyEx(regROOT, "shell", 0, NULL, 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE,
850  NULL, &regROOTshell, NULL) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
851  HKEY regShellOpen;
852  if (::RegCreateKeyEx(regROOTshell, "open", 0, NULL, 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE,
853  NULL, &regShellOpen, NULL) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
854  HKEY regShellOpenCmd;
855  if (::RegCreateKeyEx(regShellOpen, "command", 0, NULL, 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE,
856  NULL, &regShellOpenCmd, NULL) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
857  TString cmd(buf);
858  cmd += " -l \"%1\" \"";
859  cmd += fileopen;
860  cmd += "\"";
861  ::RegSetValueEx(regShellOpenCmd, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)cmd.Data(), cmd.Length() + 1);
862  ::RegCloseKey(regShellOpenCmd);
863  }
864  ::RegCloseKey(regShellOpen);
865  }
866  ::RegCloseKey(regROOTshell);
867  }
868  ::RegCloseKey(regROOT);
869 
870  if (::RegCreateKeyEx(regCUSC, ".root", 0, NULL, 0, KEY_READ | KEY_WRITE,
871  NULL, &regROOT, NULL) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
872  static const char appname[] = "ROOTDEV.ROOT";
873  ::RegSetValueEx(regROOT, NULL, 0, REG_SZ, (BYTE*)appname, sizeof(appname));
874  }
875  ::RegCloseKey(regCUSC);
876  ::RegCloseKey(regCUS);
877 
878  // tell Windows that the association was changed
879  ::SHChangeNotify(SHCNE_ASSOCCHANGED, SHCNF_IDLIST, NULL, NULL);
880  } // UpdateRegistry()
881 
882  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
883  /// return kFALSE if option "-l" was specified as main programm command arg
884 
885  bool NeedSplash()
886  {
887  static bool once = true;
888  TString arg;
889 
890  if (!once || gROOT->IsBatch()) return false;
891  TString cmdline(::GetCommandLine());
892  Int_t i = 0, from = 0;
893  while (cmdline.Tokenize(arg, from, " ")) {
894  arg.Strip(TString::kBoth);
895  if (i == 0 && ((arg != "root") && (arg != "rootn") &&
896  (arg != "root.exe") && (arg != "rootn.exe"))) return false;
897  else if ((arg == "-l") || (arg == "-b")) return false;
898  ++i;
899  }
900  if (once) {
901  once = false;
902  return true;
903  }
904  return false;
905  }
906 
907  /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
908 
909  static void SetConsoleWindowName()
910  {
911  char pszNewWindowTitle[1024]; // contains fabricated WindowTitle
912  char pszOldWindowTitle[1024]; // contains original WindowTitle
913  HANDLE hStdout;
914  CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbiInfo;
915 
916  if (!::GetConsoleTitle(pszOldWindowTitle, 1024))
917  return;
918  // format a "unique" NewWindowTitle
919  wsprintf(pszNewWindowTitle,"%d/%d", ::GetTickCount(), ::GetCurrentProcessId());
920  // change current window title
921  if (!::SetConsoleTitle(pszNewWindowTitle))
922  return;
923  // ensure window title has been updated
924  ::Sleep(40);
925  // look for NewWindowTitle
926  gConsoleWindow = (ULong_t)::FindWindow(0, pszNewWindowTitle);
927  if (gConsoleWindow) {
928  // restore original window title
929  ::ShowWindow((HWND)gConsoleWindow, SW_RESTORE);
930  //::SetForegroundWindow((HWND)gConsoleWindow);
931  ::SetConsoleTitle("ROOT session");
932  }
933  hStdout = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
934  ::SetConsoleMode(hStdout, ENABLE_PROCESSED_OUTPUT |
935  ENABLE_WRAP_AT_EOL_OUTPUT);
936  if (!::GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(hStdout, &csbiInfo))
937  return;
938  Gl_setwidth(csbiInfo.dwMaximumWindowSize.X);
939  }

941 } // end unnamed namespace

949 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
950 ///
951 
952 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::HandleConsoleEvent()
953 {
954  TSignalHandler *sh;
955  TIter next(fSignalHandler);
956  ESignals s;
957 
958  while (sh = (TSignalHandler*)next()) {
959  s = sh->GetSignal();
960  if (s == kSigInterrupt) {
961  sh->Notify();
962  Throw(SIGINT);
963  return kTRUE;
964  }
965  }
966  return kFALSE;
967 }

969 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
970 /// ctor
971 
972 TWinNTSystem::TWinNTSystem() : TSystem("WinNT", "WinNT System"),
973 fGUIThreadHandle(0), fGUIThreadId(0)
974 {
975  fhProcess = ::GetCurrentProcess();
976  fDirNameBuffer = 0;
977 
978  WSADATA WSAData;
979  int initwinsock = 0;
980 
981  if (initwinsock = ::WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(2, 0), &WSAData)) {
982  Error("TWinNTSystem()","Starting sockets failed");
983  }
984 
985  // use ::MessageBeep by default for TWinNTSystem
986  fBeepDuration = 1;
987  fBeepFreq = 0;
988  if (gEnv) {
989  fBeepDuration = gEnv->GetValue("Root.System.BeepDuration", 1);
990  fBeepFreq = gEnv->GetValue("Root.System.BeepFreq", 0);
991  }
992 
993  char *buf = new char[MAX_MODULE_NAME32 + 1];
994 
995 #ifdef ROOTPREFIX
996  if (gSystem->Getenv("ROOTIGNOREPREFIX")) {
997 #endif
998  // set ROOTSYS
999  HMODULE hModCore = ::GetModuleHandle("libCore.dll");
1000  if (hModCore) {
1001  ::GetModuleFileName(hModCore, buf, MAX_MODULE_NAME32 + 1);
1002  char *pLibName = strstr(buf, "libCore.dll");
1003  if (pLibName) {
1004  --pLibName; // skip trailing \\ or /
1005  while (--pLibName >= buf && *pLibName != '\\' && *pLibName != '/');
1006  *pLibName = 0; // replace trailing \\ or / with 0
1007  TString check_path = buf;
1008  check_path += "\\etc";
1009  // look for $ROOTSYS (it should contain the "etc" subdirectory)
1010  while (buf[0] && GetFileAttributes(check_path.Data()) == INVALID_FILE_ATTRIBUTES) {
1011  while (--pLibName >= buf && *pLibName != '\\' && *pLibName != '/');
1012  *pLibName = 0;
1013  check_path = buf;
1014  check_path += "\\etc";
1015  }
1016  if (buf[0]) {
1017  Setenv("ROOTSYS", buf);
1018  TString path = buf;
1019  path += "\\bin;";
1020  path += Getenv("PATH");
1021  Setenv("PATH", path.Data());
1022  }
1023  }
1024  }
1025 #ifdef ROOTPREFIX
1026  }
1027 #endif
1028 
1029  UpdateRegistry(this, buf);
1030 
1031  delete [] buf;
1032 }

1034 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1035 /// dtor
1036 
1037 TWinNTSystem::~TWinNTSystem()
1038 {
1039  // Revert back the accuracy of Sleep() without needing to link to winmm.lib
1040  typedef UINT (WINAPI* LPTIMEENDPERIOD)( UINT uPeriod );
1041  HINSTANCE hInstWinMM = LoadLibrary( "winmm.dll" );
1042  if( hInstWinMM ) {
1043  LPTIMEENDPERIOD pTimeEndPeriod = (LPTIMEENDPERIOD)GetProcAddress( hInstWinMM, "timeEndPeriod" );
1044  if( NULL != pTimeEndPeriod )
1045  pTimeEndPeriod(1);
1046  FreeLibrary(hInstWinMM);
1047  }
1048  // Clean up the WinSocket connectios
1049  ::WSACleanup();
1050 
1051  if (fDirNameBuffer) {
1052  delete [] fDirNameBuffer;
1053  fDirNameBuffer = 0;
1054  }
1055 
1056  if (gGlobalEvent) {
1057  ::ResetEvent(gGlobalEvent);
1058  ::CloseHandle(gGlobalEvent);
1059  gGlobalEvent = 0;
1060  }
1061  if (gTimerThreadHandle) {
1062  ::TerminateThread(gTimerThreadHandle, 0);
1063  ::CloseHandle(gTimerThreadHandle);
1064  }
1065 }

1067 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1068 /// Initialize WinNT system interface.
1069 
1070 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::Init()
1071 {
1072  const char *dir = 0;
1073 
1074  if (TSystem::Init()) {
1075  return kTRUE;
1076  }
1077 
1078  fReadmask = new TFdSet;
1079  fWritemask = new TFdSet;
1080  fReadready = new TFdSet;
1081  fWriteready = new TFdSet;
1082  fSignals = new TFdSet;
1083  fNfd = 0;
1084 
1085  //--- install default handlers
1086  // Actually: don't. If we want a stack trace we need a context for the
1087  // signal. Signals don't have one. If we don't handle them, Windows will
1088  // raise an exception, which has a context, and which is handled by
1089  // ExceptionFilter.
1090  /*
1091  WinNTSignal(kSigChild, SigHandler);
1092  WinNTSignal(kSigBus, SigHandler);
1093  WinNTSignal(kSigSegmentationViolation, SigHandler);
1094  WinNTSignal(kSigIllegalInstruction, SigHandler);
1095  WinNTSignal(kSigSystem, SigHandler);
1096  WinNTSignal(kSigPipe, SigHandler);
1097  WinNTSignal(kSigAlarm, SigHandler);
1098  WinNTSignal(kSigFloatingException, SigHandler);
1099  */
1100  ::SetUnhandledExceptionFilter(ExceptionFilter);
1101 
1102  fSigcnt = 0;
1103 
1104  // This is a fallback in case TROOT::GetRootSys() can't determine ROOTSYS
1105  static char lpFilename[MAX_PATH];
1106  if (::GetModuleFileName(
1107  NULL, // handle to module to find filename for
1108  lpFilename, // pointer to buffer to receive module path
1109  sizeof(lpFilename))) { // size of buffer, in characters
1110  const char *dirName = DirName(DirName(lpFilename));
1111  gRootDir = StrDup(dirName);
1112  } else {
1113  gRootDir = 0;
1114  }
1115 
1116  // Increase the accuracy of Sleep() without needing to link to winmm.lib
1117  typedef UINT (WINAPI* LPTIMEBEGINPERIOD)( UINT uPeriod );
1118  HINSTANCE hInstWinMM = LoadLibrary( "winmm.dll" );
1119  if( hInstWinMM ) {
1120  LPTIMEBEGINPERIOD pTimeBeginPeriod = (LPTIMEBEGINPERIOD)GetProcAddress( hInstWinMM, "timeBeginPeriod" );
1121  if( NULL != pTimeBeginPeriod )
1122  pTimeBeginPeriod(1);
1123  FreeLibrary(hInstWinMM);
1124  }
1125  gTimerThreadHandle = ::CreateThread(NULL, NULL, (LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE)ThreadStub,
1126  this, NULL, NULL);
1127 
1128  gGlobalEvent = ::CreateEvent(NULL, TRUE, FALSE, NULL);
1129  fGUIThreadHandle = ::CreateThread( NULL, 0, &GUIThreadMessageProcessingLoop, 0, 0, &fGUIThreadId );
1130 
1131  char *buf = new char[MAX_MODULE_NAME32 + 1];
1132  HMODULE hModCore = ::GetModuleHandle("libCore.dll");
1133  if (hModCore) {
1134  ::GetModuleFileName(hModCore, buf, MAX_MODULE_NAME32 + 1);
1135  char *pLibName = strstr(buf, "libCore.dll");
1136  --pLibName; // remove trailing \\ or /
1137  *pLibName = 0;
1138  // add the directory containing libCore.dll in the dynamic search path
1139  if (buf[0]) AddDynamicPath(buf);
1140  }
1141  delete [] buf;
1142  SetConsoleWindowName();
1143  fGroupsInitDone = kFALSE;
1144  fFirstFile = kTRUE;
1145 
1146  return kFALSE;
1147 }

1151 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1152 /// Base name of a file name. Base name of /user/root is root.
1153 /// But the base name of '/' is '/'
1154 /// 'c:\' is 'c:\'
1155 
1156 const char *TWinNTSystem::BaseName(const char *name)
1157 {
1158  // BB 28/10/05 : Removed (commented out) StrDup() :
1159  // - To get same behaviour on Windows and on Linux
1160  // - To avoid the need to use #ifdefs
1161  // - Solve memory leaks (mainly in TTF::SetTextFont())
1162  // No need for the calling routine to use free() anymore.
1163 
1164  if (name) {
1165  int idx = 0;
1166  const char *symbol=name;
1167 
1168  // Skip leading blanks
1169  while ( (*symbol == ' ' || *symbol == '\t') && *symbol) symbol++;
1170 
1171  if (*symbol) {
1172  if (isalpha(symbol[idx]) && symbol[idx+1] == ':') idx = 2;
1173  if ( (symbol[idx] == '/' || symbol[idx] == '\\') && symbol[idx+1] == '\0') {
1174  //return StrDup(symbol);
1175  return symbol;
1176  }
1177  } else {
1178  Error("BaseName", "name = 0");
1179  return 0;
1180  }
1181  char *cp;
1182  char *bslash = (char *)strrchr(&symbol[idx],'\\');
1183  char *rslash = (char *)strrchr(&symbol[idx],'/');
1184  if (cp = (std::max)(rslash, bslash)) {
1185  //return StrDup(++cp);
1186  return ++cp;
1187  }
1188  //return StrDup(&symbol[idx]);
1189  return &symbol[idx];
1190  }
1191  Error("BaseName", "name = 0");
1192  return 0;
1193 }
1194 
1195 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1196 /// Set the application name (from command line, argv[0]) and copy it in
1197 /// gProgName. Copy the application pathname in gProgPath.
1198 
1199 void TWinNTSystem::SetProgname(const char *name)
1200 {
1201  ULong_t idot = 0;
1202  char *dot = 0;
1203  char *progname;
1204  char *fullname = 0; // the program name with extension
1205 
1206  // On command prompt the progname can be supplied with no extension (under Windows)
1207  ULong_t namelen=name ? strlen(name) : 0;
1208  if (name && namelen > 0) {
1209  // Check whether the name contains "extention"
1210  fullname = new char[namelen+5];
1211  strlcpy(fullname, name,namelen+5);
1212  if ( !strrchr(fullname, '.') )
1213  strlcat(fullname, ".exe",namelen+5);
1214 
1215  progname = StrDup(BaseName(fullname));
1216  dot = strrchr(progname, '.');
1217  idot = dot ? (ULong_t)(dot - progname) : strlen(progname);
1218 
1219  char *which = 0;
1220 
1221  if (IsAbsoluteFileName(fullname) && !AccessPathName(fullname)) {
1222  which = StrDup(fullname);
1223  } else {
1224  which = Which(Form("%s;%s", WorkingDirectory(), Getenv("PATH")), progname);
1225  }
1226 
1227  if (which) {
1228  TString dirname;
1229  char driveletter = DriveName(which);
1230  const char *d = DirName(which);
1231 
1232  if (driveletter) {
1233  dirname.Form("%c:%s", driveletter, d);
1234  } else {
1235  dirname.Form("%s", d);
1236  }
1237 
1238  gProgPath = StrDup(dirname);
1239  } else {
1240  // Do not issue a warning - ROOT is not using gProgPath anyway.
1241  // Warning("SetProgname",
1242  // "Cannot find this program named \"%s\" (Did you create a TApplication? Is this program in your %%PATH%%?)",
1243  // fullname);
1244  gProgPath = WorkingDirectory();
1245  }
1246 
1247  // Cut the extension for progname off
1248  progname[idot] = '\0';
1249  gProgName = StrDup(progname);
1250  if (which) delete [] which;
1251  delete[] fullname;
1252  delete[] progname;
1253  }
1254  if (::NeedSplash()) {
1255  new TWin32SplashThread(FALSE);
1256  }
1257 }
1258 
1259 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1260 /// Return system error string.
1261 
1262 const char *TWinNTSystem::GetError()
1263 {
1264  Int_t err = GetErrno();
1265  if (err == 0 && GetLastErrorString() != "")
1266  return GetLastErrorString();
1267  if (err < 0 || err >= sys_nerr) {
1268  static TString error_msg;
1269  error_msg.Form("errno out of range %d", err);
1270  return error_msg;
1271  }
1272  return sys_errlist[err];
1273 }

1276 /// Return the system's host name.
1277 
1278 const char *TWinNTSystem::HostName()
1279 {
1280  if (fHostname == "")
1281  fHostname = ::getenv("COMPUTERNAME");
1282  if (fHostname == "") {
1283  // This requires a DNS query - but we need it for fallback
1284  char hn[64];
1285  DWORD il = sizeof(hn);
1286  ::GetComputerName(hn, &il);
1287  fHostname = hn;
1288  }
1289  return fHostname;
1290 }

1292 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1293 /// Beep. If freq==0 (the default for TWinNTSystem), use ::MessageBeep.
1294 /// Otherwise ::Beep with freq and duration.
1295 
1296 void TWinNTSystem::DoBeep(Int_t freq /*=-1*/, Int_t duration /*=-1*/) const
1297 {
1298  if (freq == 0) {
1299  ::MessageBeep(-1);
1300  return;
1301  }
1302  if (freq < 37) freq = 440;
1303  if (duration < 0) duration = 100;
1304  ::Beep(freq, duration);
1305 }

1327 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1328 /// Add a file handler to the list of system file handlers. Only adds
1329 /// the handler if it is not already in the list of file handlers.
1330 
1331 void TWinNTSystem::AddFileHandler(TFileHandler *h)
1332 {
1333  TSystem::AddFileHandler(h);
1334  if (h) {
1335  int fd = h->GetFd();
1336  if (!fd) return;
1337 
1338  if (h->HasReadInterest()) {
1339  fReadmask->Set(fd);
1340  }
1341  if (h->HasWriteInterest()) {
1342  fWritemask->Set(fd);
1343  }
1344  }
1345 }

1347 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1348 /// Remove a file handler from the list of file handlers. Returns
1349 /// the handler or 0 if the handler was not in the list of file handlers.
1350 
1351 TFileHandler *TWinNTSystem::RemoveFileHandler(TFileHandler *h)
1352 {
1353  if (!h) return 0;
1354 
1355  TFileHandler *oh = TSystem::RemoveFileHandler(h);
1356  if (oh) { // found
1357  fReadmask->Clr(h->GetFd());
1358  fWritemask->Clr(h->GetFd());
1359  }
1360  return oh;
1361 }

1363 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1364 /// Add a signal handler to list of system signal handlers. Only adds
1365 /// the handler if it is not already in the list of signal handlers.
1366 
1367 void TWinNTSystem::AddSignalHandler(TSignalHandler *h)
1368 {
1369  Bool_t set_console = kFALSE;
1370  ESignals sig = h->GetSignal();
1371 
1372  if (sig == kSigInterrupt) {
1373  set_console = kTRUE;
1374  TSignalHandler *hs;
1375  TIter next(fSignalHandler);
1376 
1377  while ((hs = (TSignalHandler*) next())) {
1378  if (hs->GetSignal() == kSigInterrupt)
1379  set_console = kFALSE;
1380  }
1381  }
1382  TSystem::AddSignalHandler(h);
1383 
1384  // Add our handler to the list of the console handlers
1385  if (set_console)
1386  ::SetConsoleCtrlHandler((PHANDLER_ROUTINE)ConsoleSigHandler, TRUE);
1387  else
1388  WinNTSignal(h->GetSignal(), SigHandler);
1389 }
1390 
1391 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1392 /// Remove a signal handler from list of signal handlers. Returns
1393 /// the handler or 0 if the handler was not in the list of signal handlers.
1394 
1395 TSignalHandler *TWinNTSystem::RemoveSignalHandler(TSignalHandler *h)
1396 {
1397  if (!h) return 0;
1398 
1399  int sig = h->GetSignal();
1400 
1401  if (sig = kSigInterrupt) {
1402  Bool_t last = kTRUE;
1403  TSignalHandler *hs;
1404  TIter next(fSignalHandler);
1405 
1406  while ((hs = (TSignalHandler*) next())) {
1407  if (hs->GetSignal() == kSigInterrupt)
1408  last = kFALSE;
1409  }
1410  // Remove our handler from the list of the console handlers
1411  if (last)
1412  ::SetConsoleCtrlHandler((PHANDLER_ROUTINE)ConsoleSigHandler, FALSE);
1413  }
1414  return TSystem::RemoveSignalHandler(h);
1415 }

1443 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1444 /// Print a stack trace, if gEnv entry "Root.Stacktrace" is unset or 1,
1445 /// and if the image helper functions can be found (see InitImagehlpFunctions()).
1446 /// The stack trace is printed for each thread; if fgXcptContext is set (e.g.
1447 /// because there was an exception) use it to define the current thread's context.
1448 /// For each frame in the stack, the frame's module name, the frame's function
1449 /// name, and the frame's line number are printed.
1450 
1451 void TWinNTSystem::StackTrace()
1452 {
1453  if (!gEnv->GetValue("Root.Stacktrace", 1))
1454  return;
1455 
1456  HANDLE snapshot = ::CreateToolhelp32Snapshot(TH32CS_SNAPTHREAD,::GetCurrentProcessId());
1457 
1458  std::cerr.flush();
1459  fflush (stderr);
1460 
1461  if (!InitImagehlpFunctions()) {
1462  std::cerr << "No stack trace: cannot find (functions in) dbghelp.dll!" << std::endl;
1463  return;
1464  }
1465 
1466  // what system are we on?
1467  SYSTEM_INFO sysInfo;
1468  ::GetSystemInfo(&sysInfo);
1469  DWORD machineType = IMAGE_FILE_MACHINE_I386;
1470  switch (sysInfo.wProcessorArchitecture) {
1471  case PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE_AMD64:
1472  machineType = IMAGE_FILE_MACHINE_AMD64;
1473  break;
1474  case PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE_IA64:
1475  machineType = IMAGE_FILE_MACHINE_IA64;
1476  break;
1477  }
1478 
1479  DWORD currentThreadID = ::GetCurrentThreadId();
1480  DWORD currentProcessID = ::GetCurrentProcessId();
1481 
1482  if (snapshot == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) return;
1483 
1484  THREADENTRY32 threadentry;
1485  threadentry.dwSize = sizeof(THREADENTRY32);
1486  if (!::Thread32First(snapshot, &threadentry)) return;
1487 
1488  std::cerr << std::endl << "==========================================" << std::endl;
1489  std::cerr << "=============== STACKTRACE ===============" << std::endl;
1490  std::cerr << "==========================================" << std::endl << std::endl;
1491  UInt_t iThread = 0;
1492  do {
1493  if (threadentry.th32OwnerProcessID != currentProcessID)
1494  continue;
1495  HANDLE thread = ::OpenThread(THREAD_GET_CONTEXT|THREAD_SUSPEND_RESUME|THREAD_QUERY_INFORMATION,
1496  FALSE, threadentry.th32ThreadID);
1497  CONTEXT context;
1498  memset(&context, 0, sizeof(CONTEXT));
1499 
1500  if (threadentry.th32ThreadID != currentThreadID) {
1501  ::SuspendThread(thread);
1502  context.ContextFlags = CONTEXT_ALL;
1503  ::GetThreadContext(thread, &context);
1504  ::ResumeThread(thread);
1505  } else {
1506  if (fgXcptContext) {
1507  context = *fgXcptContext;
1508  } else {
1509  typedef void (WINAPI *RTLCCTXT)(PCONTEXT);
1510  RTLCCTXT p2RtlCCtxt = (RTLCCTXT) ::GetProcAddress(
1511  GetModuleHandle("kernel32.dll"), "RtlCaptureContext");
1512  if (p2RtlCCtxt) {
1513  context.ContextFlags = CONTEXT_ALL;
1514  p2RtlCCtxt(&context);
1515  }
1516  }
1517  }
1518 
1519  STACKFRAME64 frame;
1520  ::ZeroMemory(&frame, sizeof(frame));
1521 
1522  frame.AddrPC.Mode = AddrModeFlat;
1523  frame.AddrFrame.Mode = AddrModeFlat;
1524  frame.AddrStack.Mode = AddrModeFlat;
1525 #if defined(_M_IX86)
1526  frame.AddrPC.Offset = context.Eip;
1527  frame.AddrFrame.Offset = context.Ebp;
1528  frame.AddrStack.Offset = context.Esp;
1529 #elif defined(_M_X64)
1530  frame.AddrPC.Offset = context.Rip;
1531  frame.AddrFrame.Offset = context.Rsp;
1532  frame.AddrStack.Offset = context.Rsp;
1533 #elif defined(_M_IA64)
1534  frame.AddrPC.Offset = context.StIIP;
1535  frame.AddrFrame.Offset = context.IntSp;
1536  frame.AddrStack.Offset = context.IntSp;
1537  frame.AddrBStore.Offset= context.RsBSP;
1538 #else
1539  std::cerr << "Stack traces not supported on your architecture yet." << std::endl;
1540  return;
1541 #endif
1542 
1543  Bool_t bFirst = kTRUE;
1544  while (_StackWalk64(machineType, (HANDLE)::GetCurrentProcess(), thread, (LPSTACKFRAME64)&frame,
1545  (LPVOID)&context, (PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE)NULL, (PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE)_SymFunctionTableAccess64,
1546  (PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE)_SymGetModuleBase64, NULL)) {
1547  if (bFirst)
1548  std::cerr << std::endl << "================ Thread " << iThread++ << " ================" << std::endl;
1549  if (!bFirst || threadentry.th32ThreadID != currentThreadID) {
1550  const std::string moduleName = GetModuleName(frame.AddrPC.Offset);
1551  const std::string functionName = GetFunctionName(frame.AddrPC.Offset);
1552  std::cerr << " " << moduleName << functionName << std::endl;
1553  }
1554  bFirst = kFALSE;
1555  }
1556  ::CloseHandle(thread);
1557  } while (::Thread32Next(snapshot, &threadentry));
1558 
1559  std::cerr << std::endl << "==========================================" << std::endl;
1560  std::cerr << "============= END STACKTRACE =============" << std::endl;
1561  std::cerr << "==========================================" << std::endl << std::endl;
1562  ::CloseHandle(snapshot);
1563  _SymCleanup(GetCurrentProcess());
1564 }
1565 
1566 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1567 /// Return the bitmap of conditions that trigger a floating point exception.
1568 
1569 Int_t TWinNTSystem::GetFPEMask()
1570 {
1571  Int_t mask = 0;
1572  UInt_t oldmask = _statusfp( );
1573 
1574  if (oldmask & _EM_INVALID ) mask |= kInvalid;
1575  if (oldmask & _EM_ZERODIVIDE) mask |= kDivByZero;
1576  if (oldmask & _EM_OVERFLOW ) mask |= kOverflow;
1577  if (oldmask & _EM_UNDERFLOW) mask |= kUnderflow;
1578  if (oldmask & _EM_INEXACT ) mask |= kInexact;
1579 
1580  return mask;
1581 }
1582 
1583 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1584 /// Set which conditions trigger a floating point exception.
1585 /// Return the previous set of conditions.
1586 
1587 Int_t TWinNTSystem::SetFPEMask(Int_t mask)
1588 {
1589  Int_t old = GetFPEMask();
1590 
1591  UInt_t newm = 0;
1592  if (mask & kInvalid ) newm |= _EM_INVALID;
1593  if (mask & kDivByZero) newm |= _EM_ZERODIVIDE;
1594  if (mask & kOverflow ) newm |= _EM_OVERFLOW;
1595  if (mask & kUnderflow) newm |= _EM_UNDERFLOW;
1596  if (mask & kInexact ) newm |= _EM_INEXACT;
1597 
1598  UInt_t cm = ::_statusfp();
1599  cm &= ~newm;
1600  ::_controlfp(cm , _MCW_EM);
1601 
1602  return old;
1603 }

1606 /// process pending events, i.e. DispatchOneEvent(kTRUE)

1612 
1613 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1614 /// Dispatch a single event in TApplication::Run() loop
1615 
1616 void TWinNTSystem::DispatchOneEvent(Bool_t pendingOnly)
1617 {
1618  // check for keyboard events
1619  if (pendingOnly && gGlobalEvent) ::SetEvent(gGlobalEvent);
1620 
1621  Bool_t pollOnce = pendingOnly;
1622 
1623  while (1) {
1624  if (_kbhit()) {
1625  if (gROOT->GetApplication()) {
1626  gApplication->HandleTermInput();
1627  if (gSplash) { // terminate splash window after first key press
1628  delete gSplash;
1629  gSplash = 0;
1630  }
1631  if (!pendingOnly) {
1632  return;
1633  }
1634  }
1635  }
1636  if (gROOT->IsLineProcessing() && (!gVirtualX || !gVirtualX->IsCmdThread())) {
1637  if (!pendingOnly) {
1638  // yield execution to another thread that is ready to run
1639  // if no other thread is ready, sleep 1 ms before to return
1640  if (gGlobalEvent) {
1641  ::WaitForSingleObject(gGlobalEvent, 1);
1642  ::ResetEvent(gGlobalEvent);
1643  }
1644  return;
1645  }
1646  }
1647  // first handle any GUI events
1648  if (gXDisplay && !gROOT->IsBatch()) {
1649  if (gXDisplay->Notify()) {
1650  if (!pendingOnly) {
1651  return;
1652  }
1653  }
1654  }
1655 
1656  // check for file descriptors ready for reading/writing
1657  if ((fNfd > 0) && fFileHandler && (fFileHandler->GetSize() > 0)) {
1658  if (CheckDescriptors()) {
1659  if (!pendingOnly) {
1660  return;
1661  }
1662  }
1663  }
1664  fNfd = 0;
1665  fReadready->Zero();
1666  fWriteready->Zero();
1667 
1668  if (pendingOnly && !pollOnce)
1669  return;
1670 
1671  // check synchronous signals
1672  if (fSigcnt > 0 && fSignalHandler->GetSize() > 0) {
1673  if (CheckSignals(kTRUE)) {
1674  if (!pendingOnly) {
1675  return;
1676  }
1677  }
1678  }
1679  fSigcnt = 0;
1680  fSignals->Zero();
1681 
1682  // handle past due timers
1683  Long_t nextto;
1684  if (fTimers && fTimers->GetSize() > 0) {
1685  if (DispatchTimers(kTRUE)) {
1686  // prevent timers from blocking the rest types of events
1687  nextto = NextTimeOut(kTRUE);
1688  if (nextto > (kItimerResolution>>1) || nextto == -1) {
1689  return;
1690  }
1691  }
1692  }
1693 
1694  // if in pendingOnly mode poll once file descriptor activity
1695  nextto = NextTimeOut(kTRUE);
1696  if (pendingOnly) {
1697  if (fFileHandler && fFileHandler->GetSize() == 0)
1698  return;
1699  nextto = 0;
1700  pollOnce = kFALSE;
1701  }
1702 
1703  if (fReadmask && !fReadmask->GetBits() &&
1704  fWritemask && !fWritemask->GetBits()) {
1705  // yield execution to another thread that is ready to run
1706  // if no other thread is ready, sleep 1 ms before to return
1707  if (!pendingOnly && gGlobalEvent) {
1708  ::WaitForSingleObject(gGlobalEvent, 1);
1709  ::ResetEvent(gGlobalEvent);
1710  }
1711  return;
1712  }
1713 
1714  *fReadready = *fReadmask;
1715  *fWriteready = *fWritemask;
1716 
1717  fNfd = WinNTSelect(fReadready, fWriteready, nextto);
1718 
1719  // serious error has happened -> reset all file descrptors
1720  if ((fNfd < 0) && (fNfd != -2)) {
1721  int rc, i;
1722 
1723  for (i = 0; i < fReadmask->GetCount(); i++) {
1724  TFdSet t;
1725  Int_t fd = fReadmask->GetFd(i);
1726  t.Set(fd);
1727  if (fReadmask->IsSet(fd)) {
1728  rc = WinNTSelect(&t, 0, 0);
1729  if (rc < 0 && rc != -2) {
1730  ::SysError("DispatchOneEvent", "select: read error on %d\n", fd);
1731  fReadmask->Clr(fd);
1732  }
1733  }
1734  }
1735 
1736  for (i = 0; i < fWritemask->GetCount(); i++) {
1737  TFdSet t;
1738  Int_t fd = fWritemask->GetFd(i);
1739  t.Set(fd);
1740 
1741  if (fWritemask->IsSet(fd)) {
1742  rc = WinNTSelect(0, &t, 0);
1743  if (rc < 0 && rc != -2) {
1744  ::SysError("DispatchOneEvent", "select: write error on %d\n", fd);
1745  fWritemask->Clr(fd);
1746  }
1747  }
1748  t.Clr(fd);
1749  }
1750  }
1751  }
1752 }
1753

1759  TSystem::ExitLoop();

1762 //---- handling of system events -----------------------------------------------
1763 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1764 /// Handle and dispatch signals.
1765 
1766 void TWinNTSystem::DispatchSignals(ESignals sig)
1767 {
1768  if (sig == kSigInterrupt) {
1769  fSignals->Set(sig);
1770  fSigcnt++;
1771  }
1772  else {
1773  StackTrace();
1774  if (TROOT::Initialized()) {
1775  ::Throw(sig);
1776  }
1777  Abort(-1);
1778  }
1779 
1780  // check a-synchronous signals
1781  if (fSigcnt > 0 && fSignalHandler->GetSize() > 0)
1782  CheckSignals(kFALSE);
1783 }
1784 
1785 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1786 /// Check if some signals were raised and call their Notify() member.
1787 
1788 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::CheckSignals(Bool_t sync)
1789 {
1790  TSignalHandler *sh;
1791  Int_t sigdone = -1;
1792  {
1793  TIter next(fSignalHandler);
1794 
1795  while (sh = (TSignalHandler*)next()) {
1796  if (sync == sh->IsSync()) {
1797  ESignals sig = sh->GetSignal();
1798  if ((fSignals->IsSet(sig) && sigdone == -1) || sigdone == sig) {
1799  if (sigdone == -1) {
1800  fSignals->Clr(sig);
1801  sigdone = sig;
1802  fSigcnt--;
1803  }
1804  sh->Notify();
1805  }
1806  }
1807  }
1808  }
1809  if (sigdone != -1) return kTRUE;
1810 
1811  return kFALSE;
1812 }
1813 
1814 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1815 /// Check if there is activity on some file descriptors and call their
1816 /// Notify() member.
1817 
1818 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::CheckDescriptors()
1819 {
1820  TFileHandler *fh;
1821  Int_t fddone = -1;
1822  Bool_t read = kFALSE;
1823 
1824  TOrdCollectionIter it((TOrdCollection*)fFileHandler);
1825 
1826  while ((fh = (TFileHandler*) it.Next())) {
1827  Int_t fd = fh->GetFd();
1828  if (!fd) continue; // ignore TTermInputHandler
1829 
1830  if ((fReadready->IsSet(fd) && fddone == -1) ||
1831  (fddone == fd && read)) {
1832  if (fddone == -1) {
1833  fReadready->Clr(fd);
1834  fddone = fd;
1835  read = kTRUE;
1836  fNfd--;
1837  }
1838  fh->ReadNotify();
1839  }
1840  if ((fWriteready->IsSet(fd) && fddone == -1) ||
1841  (fddone == fd && !read)) {
1842  if (fddone == -1) {
1843  fWriteready->Clr(fd);
1844  fddone = fd;
1845  read = kFALSE;
1846  fNfd--;
1847  }
1848  fh->WriteNotify();
1849  }
1850  }
1851  if (fddone != -1) return kTRUE;
1852 
1853  return kFALSE;
1854 }
1855 
1856 //---- Directories -------------------------------------------------------------
1857 
1858 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1859 /// Make a file system directory. Returns 0 in case of success and
1860 /// -1 if the directory could not be created (either already exists or
1861 /// illegal path name).
1862 /// If 'recursive' is true, makes parent directories as needed.
1863 
1864 int TWinNTSystem::mkdir(const char *name, Bool_t recursive)
1865 {
1866  if (recursive) {
1867  TString dirname = DirName(name);
1868  if (dirname.Length() == 0) {
1869  // well we should not have to make the root of the file system!
1870  // (and this avoid infinite recursions!)
1871  return 0;
1872  }
1873  if (IsAbsoluteFileName(name)) {
1874  // For some good reason DirName strips off the drive letter
1875  // (if present), we need it to make the directory on the
1876  // right disk, so let's put it back!
1877  const char driveletter = DriveName(name);
1878  if (driveletter) {
1879  dirname.Prepend(":");
1880  dirname.Prepend(driveletter);
1881  }
1882  }
1883  if (AccessPathName(dirname, kFileExists)) {
1884  int res = this->mkdir(dirname, kTRUE);
1885  if (res) return res;
1886  }
1887  if (!AccessPathName(name, kFileExists)) {
1888  return -1;
1889  }
1890  }
1891  return MakeDirectory(name);
1892 }
1893 
1894 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1895 /// Make a WinNT file system directory. Returns 0 in case of success and
1896 /// -1 if the directory could not be created (either already exists or
1897 /// illegal path name).
1898 
1899 int TWinNTSystem::MakeDirectory(const char *name)
1900 {
1901  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(name);
1902  if (helper) {
1903  return helper->MakeDirectory(name);
1904  }
1905  const char *proto = (strstr(name, "file:///")) ? "file://" : "file:";
1906 #ifdef WATCOM
1907  // It must be as follows
1908  if (!name) return 0;
1909  return ::mkdir(StripOffProto(name, proto));
1910 #else
1911  // but to be in line with TUnixSystem I did like this
1912  if (!name) return 0;
1913  return ::_mkdir(StripOffProto(name, proto));
1914 #endif
1915 }
1916 
1917 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1918 /// Close a WinNT file system directory.
1919 
1920 void TWinNTSystem::FreeDirectory(void *dirp)
1921 {
1922  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(0, dirp);
1923  if (helper) {
1924  helper->FreeDirectory(dirp);
1925  return;
1926  }
1927 
1928  if (dirp) {
1929  ::FindClose(dirp);
1930  }
1931 }
1932 
1933 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1934 /// Returns the next directory entry.
1935 
1936 const char *TWinNTSystem::GetDirEntry(void *dirp)
1937 {
1938  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(0, dirp);
1939  if (helper) {
1940  return helper->GetDirEntry(dirp);
1941  }
1942 
1943  if (dirp) {
1944  HANDLE searchFile = (HANDLE)dirp;
1945  if (fFirstFile) {
1946  // when calling TWinNTSystem::OpenDirectory(), the fFindFileData
1947  // structure is filled by a call to FindFirstFile().
1948  // So first returns this one, before calling FindNextFile()
1949  fFirstFile = kFALSE;
1950  return (const char *)fFindFileData.cFileName;
1951  }
1952  if (::FindNextFile(searchFile, &fFindFileData)) {
1953  return (const char *)fFindFileData.cFileName;
1954  }
1955  }
1956  return 0;
1957 }
1958 
1959 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1960 /// Change directory.
1961 
1962 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::ChangeDirectory(const char *path)
1963 {
1964  Bool_t ret = (Bool_t) (::chdir(path) == 0);
1965  if (fWdpath != "")
1966  fWdpath = ""; // invalidate path cache
1967  return ret;
1968 }
1969 
1970 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1971 ///
1972 /// Inline function to check for a double-backslash at the
1973 /// beginning of a string
1974 ///
1975 
1976 __inline BOOL DBL_BSLASH(LPCTSTR psz)
1977 {
1978  return (psz[0] == TEXT('\\') && psz[1] == TEXT('\\'));
1979 }
1980 
1981 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1982 /// Returns TRUE if the given string is a UNC path.
1983 ///
1984 /// TRUE
1985 /// "\\foo\bar"
1986 /// "\\foo" <- careful
1987 /// "\\"
1988 /// FALSE
1989 /// "\foo"
1990 /// "foo"
1991 /// "c:\foo"
1992 
1993 BOOL PathIsUNC(LPCTSTR pszPath)
1994 {
1995  return DBL_BSLASH(pszPath);
1996 }
1997 
1998 #pragma data_seg(".text", "CODE")
1999 const TCHAR c_szColonSlash[] = TEXT(":\\");
2000 #pragma data_seg()
2001 
2002 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2003 ///
2004 /// check if a path is a root
2005 ///
2006 /// returns:
2007 /// TRUE for "\" "X:\" "\\foo\asdf" "\\foo\"
2008 /// FALSE for others
2009 ///
2010 
2011 BOOL PathIsRoot(LPCTSTR pPath)
2012 {
2013  if (!IsDBCSLeadByte(*pPath)) {
2014  if (!lstrcmpi(pPath + 1, c_szColonSlash))
2015  // "X:\" case
2016  return TRUE;
2017  }
2018  if ((*pPath == TEXT('\\')) && (*(pPath + 1) == 0))
2019  // "\" case
2020  return TRUE;
2021  if (DBL_BSLASH(pPath)) {
2022  // smells like UNC name
2023  LPCTSTR p;
2024  int cBackslashes = 0;
2025  for (p = pPath + 2; *p; p = CharNext(p)) {
2026  if (*p == TEXT('\\') && (++cBackslashes > 1))
2027  return FALSE; // not a bare UNC name, therefore not a root dir
2028  }
2029  // end of string with only 1 more backslash
2030  // must be a bare UNC, which looks like a root dir
2031  return TRUE;
2032  }
2033  return FALSE;
2034 }
2035 
2036 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2037 /// Open a directory. Returns 0 if directory does not exist.
2038 
2039 void *TWinNTSystem::OpenDirectory(const char *fdir)
2040 {
2041  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(fdir);
2042  if (helper) {
2043  return helper->OpenDirectory(fdir);
2044  }
2045 
2046  const char *proto = (strstr(fdir, "file:///")) ? "file://" : "file:";
2047  const char *sdir = StripOffProto(fdir, proto);
2048 
2049  char *dir = new char[MAX_PATH];
2050  if (IsShortcut(sdir)) {
2051  if (!ResolveShortCut(sdir, dir, MAX_PATH))
2052  strlcpy(dir, sdir,MAX_PATH);
2053  }
2054  else
2055  strlcpy(dir, sdir,MAX_PATH);
2056 
2057  int nche = strlen(dir)+3;
2058  char *entry = new char[nche];
2059  struct _stati64 finfo;
2060 
2061  if(PathIsUNC(dir)) {
2062  strlcpy(entry, dir,nche);
2063  if ((entry[strlen(dir)-1] == '/') || (entry[strlen(dir)-1] == '\\' )) {
2064  entry[strlen(dir)-1] = '\0';
2065  }
2066  if(PathIsRoot(entry)) {
2067  strlcat(entry,"\\",nche);
2068  }
2069  if (_stati64(entry, &finfo) < 0) {
2070  delete [] entry;
2071  delete [] dir;
2072  return 0;
2073  }
2074  }
2075  else {
2076  strlcpy(entry, dir,nche);
2077  if ((entry[strlen(dir)-1] == '/') || (entry[strlen(dir)-1] == '\\' )) {
2078  if(!PathIsRoot(entry))
2079  entry[strlen(dir)-1] = '\0';
2080  }
2081  if (_stati64(entry, &finfo) < 0) {
2082  delete [] entry;
2083  delete [] dir;
2084  return 0;
2085  }
2086  }
2087 
2088  if (finfo.st_mode & S_IFDIR) {
2089  strlcpy(entry, dir,nche);
2090  if (!(entry[strlen(dir)-1] == '/' || entry[strlen(dir)-1] == '\\' )) {
2091  strlcat(entry,"\\",nche);
2092  }
2093  if (entry[strlen(dir)-1] == ' ')
2094  entry[strlen(dir)-1] = '\0';
2095  strlcat(entry,"*",nche);
2096 
2097  HANDLE searchFile;
2098  searchFile = ::FindFirstFile(entry, &fFindFileData);
2099  if (searchFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
2100  ((TWinNTSystem *)gSystem)->Error( "Unable to find' for reading:", entry);
2101  delete [] entry;
2102  delete [] dir;
2103  return 0;
2104  }
2105  delete [] entry;
2106  delete [] dir;
2107  fFirstFile = kTRUE;
2108  return searchFile;
2109  } else {
2110  delete [] entry;
2111  delete [] dir;
2112  return 0;
2113  }
2114 }

2199 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2200 /// Fill buffer with user's home directory.
2201 
2202 void TWinNTSystem::FillWithHomeDirectory(const char *userName, char *mydir) const
2203 {
2204  const char *h = 0;
2205  if (!(h = ::getenv("home"))) h = ::getenv("HOME");
2206 
2207  if (h) {
2208  strlcpy(mydir, h,kMAXPATHLEN);
2209  } else {
2210  // for Windows NT HOME might be defined as either $(HOMESHARE)/$(HOMEPATH)
2211  // or $(HOMEDRIVE)/$(HOMEPATH)
2212  h = ::getenv("HOMESHARE");
2213  if (!h) h = ::getenv("HOMEDRIVE");
2214  if (h) {
2215  strlcpy(mydir, h,kMAXPATHLEN);
2216  h = ::getenv("HOMEPATH");
2217  if(h) strlcat(mydir, h,kMAXPATHLEN);
2218  }
2219  // on Windows Vista HOME is usually defined as $(USERPROFILE)
2220  if (!h) {
2221  h = ::getenv("USERPROFILE");
2222  if (h) strlcpy(mydir, h,kMAXPATHLEN);
2223  }
2224  }
2225  // Make sure the drive letter is upper case
2226  if (mydir[1] == ':')
2227  mydir[0] = toupper(mydir[0]);
2228 }

2250 /// 6 letter string to base. The file will be created in

2272 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2273 /// Get list of volumes (drives) mounted on the system.
2274 /// The returned TList must be deleted by the user using "delete".
2275 
2276 TList *TWinNTSystem::GetVolumes(Option_t *opt) const
2277 {
2278  Int_t curdrive;
2279  UInt_t type;
2280  TString sDrive, sType;
2281  char szFs[32];
2282 
2283  if (!opt || !opt[0]) {
2284  return 0;
2285  }
2286 
2287  // prevent the system dialog box to pop-up if a drive is empty
2288  UINT nOldErrorMode = ::SetErrorMode(SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS);
2289  TList *drives = new TList();
2290  drives->SetOwner();
2291  // Save current drive
2292  curdrive = _getdrive();
2293  if (strstr(opt, "cur")) {
2294  *szFs='\0';
2295  sDrive.Form("%c:", (curdrive + 'A' - 1));
2296  sType.Form("Unknown Drive (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2297  ::GetVolumeInformation(Form("%s\\", sDrive.Data()), NULL, 0, NULL, NULL,
2298  NULL, (LPSTR)szFs, 32);
2299  type = ::GetDriveType(sDrive.Data());
2300  switch (type) {
2301  case DRIVE_UNKNOWN:
2302  case DRIVE_NO_ROOT_DIR:
2303  break;
2304  case DRIVE_REMOVABLE:
2305  sType.Form("Removable Disk (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2306  break;
2307  case DRIVE_FIXED:
2308  sType.Form("Local Disk (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2309  break;
2310  case DRIVE_REMOTE:
2311  sType.Form("Network Drive (%s) (%s)", szFs, sDrive.Data());
2312  break;
2313  case DRIVE_CDROM:
2314  sType.Form("CD/DVD Drive (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2315  break;
2316  case DRIVE_RAMDISK:
2317  sType.Form("RAM Disk (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2318  break;
2319  }
2320  drives->Add(new TNamed(sDrive.Data(), sType.Data()));
2321  }
2322  else if (strstr(opt, "all")) {
2323  TCHAR szTemp[512];
2324  szTemp[0] = '\0';
2325  if (::GetLogicalDriveStrings(511, szTemp)) {
2326  TCHAR szDrive[3] = TEXT(" :");
2327  TCHAR* p = szTemp;
2328  do {
2329  // Copy the drive letter to the template string
2330  *szDrive = *p;
2331  *szFs='\0';
2332  sDrive.Form("%s", szDrive);
2333  // skip floppy drives, to avoid accessing them each time...
2334  if ((sDrive == "A:") || (sDrive == "B:")) {
2335  while (*p++);
2336  continue;
2337  }
2338  sType.Form("Unknown Drive (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2339  ::GetVolumeInformation(Form("%s\\", sDrive.Data()), NULL, 0, NULL,
2340  NULL, NULL, (LPSTR)szFs, 32);
2341  type = ::GetDriveType(sDrive.Data());
2342  switch (type) {
2343  case DRIVE_UNKNOWN:
2344  case DRIVE_NO_ROOT_DIR:
2345  break;
2346  case DRIVE_REMOVABLE:
2347  sType.Form("Removable Disk (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2348  break;
2349  case DRIVE_FIXED:
2350  sType.Form("Local Disk (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2351  break;
2352  case DRIVE_REMOTE:
2353  sType.Form("Network Drive (%s) (%s)", szFs, sDrive.Data());
2354  break;
2355  case DRIVE_CDROM:
2356  sType.Form("CD/DVD Drive (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2357  break;
2358  case DRIVE_RAMDISK:
2359  sType.Form("RAM Disk (%s)", sDrive.Data());
2360  break;
2361  }
2362  drives->Add(new TNamed(sDrive.Data(), sType.Data()));
2363  // Go to the next NULL character.
2364  while (*p++);
2365  } while (*p); // end of string
2366  }
2367  }
2368  // restore previous error mode
2369  ::SetErrorMode(nOldErrorMode);
2370  return drives;
2371 }

2373 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2374 /// Return the directory name in pathname. DirName of c:/user/root is /user.
2375 /// It creates output with 'new char []' operator. Returned string has to
2376 /// be deleted.
2377 
2378 const char *TWinNTSystem::DirName(const char *pathname)
2379 {
2380  // Delete old buffer
2381  if (fDirNameBuffer) {
2382  // delete [] fDirNameBuffer;
2383  fDirNameBuffer = 0;
2384  }
2385 
2386  // Create a buffer to keep the path name
2387  if (pathname) {
2388  if (strchr(pathname, '/') || strchr(pathname, '\\')) {
2389  const char *rslash = strrchr(pathname, '/');
2390  const char *bslash = strrchr(pathname, '\\');
2391  const char *r = (std::max)(rslash, bslash);
2392  const char *ptr = pathname;
2393  while (ptr <= r) {
2394  if (*ptr == ':') {
2395  // Windows path may contain a drive letter
2396  // For NTFS ":" may be a "stream" delimiter as well
2397  pathname = ptr + 1;
2398  break;
2399  }
2400  ptr++;
2401  }
2402  int len = r - pathname;
2403  if (len > 0) {
2404  fDirNameBuffer = new char[len+1];
2405  memcpy(fDirNameBuffer, pathname, len);
2406  fDirNameBuffer[len] = 0;
2407  }
2408  }
2409  }
2410  if (!fDirNameBuffer) {
2411  fDirNameBuffer = new char[1];
2412  *fDirNameBuffer = '\0'; // Set the empty default response
2413  }
2414  return fDirNameBuffer;
2415 }
2416 
2417 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2418 /// Return the drive letter in pathname. DriveName of 'c:/user/root' is 'c'
2419 ///
2420 /// Input:
2421 /// - pathname - the string containing file name
2422 ///
2423 /// Return:
2424 /// - Letter representing the drive letter in the file name
2425 /// - The current drive if the pathname has no drive assigment
2426 /// - 0 if pathname is an empty string or uses UNC syntax
2427 ///
2428 /// Note:
2429 /// It doesn't check whether pathname represents a 'real' filename.
2430 /// This subroutine looks for 'single letter' followed by a ':'.
2431 
2432 const char TWinNTSystem::DriveName(const char *pathname)
2433 {
2434  if (!pathname) return 0;
2435  if (!pathname[0]) return 0;
2436 
2437  const char *lpchar;
2438  lpchar = pathname;
2439 
2440  // Skip blanks
2441  while(*lpchar == ' ') lpchar++;
2442 
2443  if (isalpha((int)*lpchar) && *(lpchar+1) == ':') {
2444  return *lpchar;
2445  }
2446  // Test UNC syntax
2447  if ( (*lpchar == '\\' || *lpchar == '/' ) &&
2448  (*(lpchar+1) == '\\' || *(lpchar+1) == '/') ) return 0;
2449 
2450  // return the current drive
2451  return DriveName(WorkingDirectory());
2452 }

2454 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

2456 
2457 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::IsAbsoluteFileName(const char *dir)
2458 {
2459  if (dir) {
2460  int idx = 0;
2461  if (strchr(dir,':')) idx = 2;
2462  return (dir[idx] == '/' || dir[idx] == '\\');
2463  }
2464  return kFALSE;
2465 }

2467 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2468 /// Convert a pathname to a unix pathname. E.g. form \user\root to /user/root.
2469 /// General rules for applications creating names for directories and files or
2470 /// processing names supplied by the user include the following:
2471 ///
2472 /// * Use any character in the current code page for a name, but do not use
2473 /// a path separator, a character in the range 0 through 31, or any character
2474 /// explicitly disallowed by the file system. A name can contain characters
2475 /// in the extended character set (128-255).
2476 /// * Use the backslash (\), the forward slash (/), or both to separate
2477 /// components in a path. No other character is acceptable as a path separator.
2478 /// * Use a period (.) as a directory component in a path to represent the
2479 /// current directory.
2480 /// * Use two consecutive periods (..) as a directory component in a path to
2481 /// represent the parent of the current directory.
2482 /// * Use a period (.) to separate components in a directory name or filename.
2483 /// * Do not use the following characters in directory names or filenames, because
2484 /// they are reserved for Windows:
2485 /// < > : " / \ |
2486 /// * Do not use reserved words, such as aux, con, and prn, as filenames or
2487 /// directory names.
2488 /// * Process a path as a null-terminated string. The maximum length for a path
2489 /// is given by MAX_PATH.
2490 /// * Do not assume case sensitivity. Consider names such as OSCAR, Oscar, and
2491 /// oscar to be the same.
2492 
2493 const char *TWinNTSystem::UnixPathName(const char *name)
2494 {
2495  const int kBufSize = 1024;
2496  TTHREAD_TLS_ARRAY(char, kBufSize, temp);
2497 
2498  strlcpy(temp, name, kBufSize);
2499  char *currentChar = temp;
2500 
2501  // This can not change the size of the string.
2502  while (*currentChar != '\0') {
2503  if (*currentChar == '\\') *currentChar = '/';
2504  currentChar++;
2505  }
2506  return temp;
2507 }

2509 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2510 /// Returns FALSE if one can access a file using the specified access mode.
2511 /// Mode is the same as for the WinNT access(2) function.
2512 /// Attention, bizarre convention of return value!!
2513 
2514 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::AccessPathName(const char *path, EAccessMode mode)
2515 {
2516  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(path);
2517  if (helper)
2518  return helper->AccessPathName(path, mode);
2519 
2520  // prevent the system dialog box to pop-up if a drive is empty
2521  UINT nOldErrorMode = ::SetErrorMode(SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS);
2522  if (mode==kExecutePermission)
2523  // cannot test on exe - use read instead
2524  mode=kReadPermission;
2525  const char *proto = (strstr(path, "file:///")) ? "file://" : "file:";
2526  if (::_access(StripOffProto(path, proto), mode) == 0) {
2527  // restore previous error mode
2528  ::SetErrorMode(nOldErrorMode);
2529  return kFALSE;
2530  }
2531  GetLastErrorString() = GetError();
2532  // restore previous error mode
2533  ::SetErrorMode(nOldErrorMode);
2534  return kTRUE;
2535 }

2550 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2551 /// Concatenate a directory and a file name.
2552 
2553 const char *TWinNTSystem::PrependPathName(const char *dir, TString& name)
2554 {
2555  if (name == ".") name = "";
2556  if (dir && dir[0]) {
2557  // Test whether the last symbol of the directory is a separator
2558  char last = dir[strlen(dir) - 1];
2559  if (last != '/' && last != '\\') {
2560  name.Prepend('\\');
2561  }
2562  name.Prepend(dir);
2563  name.ReplaceAll("/", "\\");
2564  }
2565  return name.Data();
2566 }

2570 /// file will be overwritten. Returns 0 when successful, -1 in case
2571 /// of failure, -2 in case the file already exists and overwrite was false.
2572 
2573 int TWinNTSystem::CopyFile(const char *f, const char *t, Bool_t overwrite)
2574 {
2575  if (AccessPathName(f, kReadPermission)) return -1;
2576  if (!AccessPathName(t) && !overwrite) return -2;
2577 
2578  Bool_t ret = ::CopyFileA(f, t, kFALSE);
2579 
2580  if (!ret) return -1;
2581  return 0;
2582 }

2594 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2595 /// Get info about a file. Info is returned in the form of a FileStat_t
2596 /// structure (see TSystem.h).
2597 /// The function returns 0 in case of success and 1 if the file could
2598 /// not be stat'ed.
2599 
2600 int TWinNTSystem::GetPathInfo(const char *path, FileStat_t &buf)
2601 {
2602  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(path);
2603  if (helper)
2604  return helper->GetPathInfo(path, buf);
2605 
2606  struct _stati64 sbuf;
2607 
2608  // Remove trailing backslashes
2609  const char *proto = (strstr(path, "file:///")) ? "file://" : "file:";
2610  char *newpath = StrDup(StripOffProto(path, proto));
2611  int l = strlen(newpath);
2612  while (l > 1) {
2613  if (newpath[--l] != '\\' || newpath[--l] != '/') {
2614  break;
2615  }
2616  newpath[l] = '\0';
2617  }
2618 
2619  if (newpath && ::_stati64(newpath, &sbuf) >= 0) {
2620 
2621  buf.fDev = sbuf.st_dev;
2622  buf.fIno = sbuf.st_ino;
2623  buf.fMode = sbuf.st_mode;
2624  buf.fUid = sbuf.st_uid;
2625  buf.fGid = sbuf.st_gid;
2626  buf.fSize = sbuf.st_size;
2627  buf.fMtime = sbuf.st_mtime;
2628  buf.fIsLink = IsShortcut(newpath); // kFALSE;
2629 
2630  char *lpath = new char[MAX_PATH];
2631  if (IsShortcut(newpath)) {
2632  struct _stati64 sbuf2;
2633  if (ResolveShortCut(newpath, lpath, MAX_PATH)) {
2634  if (::_stati64(lpath, &sbuf2) >= 0) {
2635  buf.fMode = sbuf2.st_mode;
2636  }
2637  }
2638  }
2639  delete [] lpath;
2640 
2641  delete [] newpath;
2642  return 0;
2643  }
2644  delete [] newpath;
2645  return 1;
2646 }

2648 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2649 /// Get info about a file system: id, bsize, bfree, blocks.
2650 /// Id is file system type (machine dependend, see statfs())
2651 /// Bsize is block size of file system
2652 /// Blocks is total number of blocks in file system
2653 /// Bfree is number of free blocks in file system
2654 /// The function returns 0 in case of success and 1 if the file system could
2655 /// not be stat'ed.
2656 
2657 int TWinNTSystem::GetFsInfo(const char *path, Long_t *id, Long_t *bsize,
2658  Long_t *blocks, Long_t *bfree)
2659 {
2660  // address of root directory of the file system
2661  LPCTSTR lpRootPathName = path;
2662 
2663  // address of name of the volume
2664  LPTSTR lpVolumeNameBuffer = 0;
2665  DWORD nVolumeNameSize = 0;
2666 
2667  DWORD volumeSerialNumber; // volume serial number
2668  DWORD maximumComponentLength; // system's maximum filename length
2669 
2670  // file system flags
2671  DWORD fileSystemFlags;
2672 
2673  // address of name of file system
2674  char fileSystemNameBuffer[512];
2675  DWORD nFileSystemNameSize = sizeof(fileSystemNameBuffer);
2676 
2677  // prevent the system dialog box to pop-up if the drive is empty
2678  UINT nOldErrorMode = ::SetErrorMode(SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS);
2679  if (!::GetVolumeInformation(lpRootPathName,
2680  lpVolumeNameBuffer, nVolumeNameSize,
2681  &volumeSerialNumber,
2682  &maximumComponentLength,
2683  &fileSystemFlags,
2684  fileSystemNameBuffer, nFileSystemNameSize)) {
2685  // restore previous error mode
2686  ::SetErrorMode(nOldErrorMode);
2687  return 1;
2688  }
2689 
2690  const char *fsNames[] = { "FAT", "NTFS" };
2691  int i;
2692  for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
2693  if (!strncmp(fileSystemNameBuffer, fsNames[i], nFileSystemNameSize))
2694  break;
2695  }
2696  *id = i;
2697 
2698  DWORD sectorsPerCluster; // # sectors per cluster
2699  DWORD bytesPerSector; // # bytes per sector
2700  DWORD numberOfFreeClusters; // # free clusters
2701  DWORD totalNumberOfClusters; // # total of clusters
2702 
2703  if (!::GetDiskFreeSpace(lpRootPathName,
2704  &sectorsPerCluster,
2705  &bytesPerSector,
2706  &numberOfFreeClusters,
2707  &totalNumberOfClusters)) {
2708  // restore previous error mode
2709  ::SetErrorMode(nOldErrorMode);
2710  return 1;
2711  }
2712  // restore previous error mode
2713  ::SetErrorMode(nOldErrorMode);
2714 
2715  *bsize = sectorsPerCluster * bytesPerSector;
2716  *blocks = totalNumberOfClusters;
2717  *bfree = numberOfFreeClusters;
2718 
2719  return 0;
2720 }

2722 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2723 /// Create a link from file1 to file2.
2724 
2725 int TWinNTSystem::Link(const char *from, const char *to)
2726 {
2727  struct _stati64 finfo;
2728  char winDrive[256];
2729  char winDir[256];
2730  char winName[256];
2731  char winExt[256];
2732  char linkname[1024];
2733  LPTSTR lpszFilePart;
2734  TCHAR szPath[MAX_PATH];
2735  DWORD dwRet = 0;
2736 
2737  typedef BOOL (__stdcall *CREATEHARDLINKPROC)( LPCTSTR, LPCTSTR, LPSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES );
2738  static CREATEHARDLINKPROC _CreateHardLink = 0;
2739 
2740  HMODULE hModImagehlp = LoadLibrary( "Kernel32.dll" );
2741  if (!hModImagehlp)
2742  return -1;
2743 
2744 #ifdef _UNICODE
2745  _CreateHardLink = (CREATEHARDLINKPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CreateHardLinkW" );
2746 #else
2747  _CreateHardLink = (CREATEHARDLINKPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CreateHardLinkA" );
2748 #endif
2749  if (!_CreateHardLink)
2750  return -1;
2751 
2752  dwRet = GetFullPathName(from, sizeof(szPath) / sizeof(TCHAR),
2753  szPath, &lpszFilePart);
2754 
2755  if (_stati64(szPath, &finfo) < 0)
2756  return -1;
2757 
2758  if (finfo.st_mode & S_IFDIR)
2759  return -1;
2760 
2761  snprintf(linkname,1024,"%s",to);
2762  _splitpath(linkname,winDrive,winDir,winName,winExt);
2763  if ((!winDrive[0] ) &&
2764  (!winDir[0] )) {
2765  _splitpath(szPath,winDrive,winDir,winName,winExt);
2766  snprintf(linkname,1024,"%s\\%s\\%s", winDrive, winDir, to);
2767  }
2768  else if (!winDrive[0]) {
2769  _splitpath(szPath,winDrive,winDir,winName,winExt);
2770  snprintf(linkname,1024,"%s\\%s", winDrive, to);
2771  }
2772 
2773  if (!_CreateHardLink(linkname, szPath, NULL))
2774  return -1;
2775 
2776  return 0;
2777 }
