2779 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2780 /// Create a symlink from file1 to file2. Returns 0 when successful,
2781 /// -1 in case of failure.
2782 
2783 int TWinNTSystem::Symlink(const char *from, const char *to)
2784 {
2785  HRESULT hRes; /* Returned COM result code */
2786  IShellLink* pShellLink; /* IShellLink object pointer */
2787  IPersistFile* pPersistFile; /* IPersistFile object pointer */
2788  WCHAR wszLinkfile[MAX_PATH]; /* pszLinkfile as Unicode string */
2789  int iWideCharsWritten; /* Number of wide characters written */
2790  DWORD dwRet = 0;
2791  LPTSTR lpszFilePart;
2792  TCHAR szPath[MAX_PATH];
2793 
2794  hRes = E_INVALIDARG;
2795  if ((from == NULL) || (!from[0]) || (to == NULL) ||
2796  (!to[0]))
2797  return -1;
2798 
2799  // Make typedefs for some ole32.dll functions so that we can use them
2800  // with GetProcAddress
2801  typedef HRESULT (__stdcall *COINITIALIZEPROC)( LPVOID );
2802  static COINITIALIZEPROC _CoInitialize = 0;
2803  typedef void (__stdcall *COUNINITIALIZEPROC)( void );
2804  static COUNINITIALIZEPROC _CoUninitialize = 0;
2805  typedef HRESULT (__stdcall *COCREATEINSTANCEPROC)( REFCLSID, LPUNKNOWN, DWORD, REFIID, LPVOID );
2806  static COCREATEINSTANCEPROC _CoCreateInstance = 0;
2807 
2808  HMODULE hModImagehlp = LoadLibrary( "ole32.dll" );
2809  if (!hModImagehlp)
2810  return -1;
2811 
2812  _CoInitialize = (COINITIALIZEPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CoInitialize" );
2813  if (!_CoInitialize)
2814  return -1;
2815  _CoUninitialize = (COUNINITIALIZEPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CoUninitialize" );
2816  if (!_CoUninitialize)
2817  return -1;
2818  _CoCreateInstance = (COCREATEINSTANCEPROC) GetProcAddress( hModImagehlp, "CoCreateInstance" );
2819  if (!_CoCreateInstance)
2820  return -1;
2821 
2822  TString linkname(to);
2823  if (!linkname.EndsWith(".lnk"))
2824  linkname.Append(".lnk");
2825 
2826  _CoInitialize(NULL);
2827 
2828  // Retrieve the full path and file name of a specified file
2829  dwRet = GetFullPathName(from, sizeof(szPath) / sizeof(TCHAR),
2830  szPath, &lpszFilePart);
2831  hRes = _CoCreateInstance(CLSID_ShellLink, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
2832  IID_IShellLink, (LPVOID *)&pShellLink);
2833  if (SUCCEEDED(hRes)) {
2834  // Set the fields in the IShellLink object
2835  hRes = pShellLink->SetPath(szPath);
2836  // Use the IPersistFile object to save the shell link
2837  hRes = pShellLink->QueryInterface(IID_IPersistFile, (void **)&pPersistFile);
2838  if (SUCCEEDED(hRes)){
2839  iWideCharsWritten = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, linkname.Data(), -1,
2840  wszLinkfile, MAX_PATH);
2841  hRes = pPersistFile->Save(wszLinkfile, TRUE);
2842  pPersistFile->Release();
2843  }
2844  pShellLink->Release();
2845  }
2846  _CoUninitialize();
2847  return 0;
2848 }

2887 // expand the metacharacters as in the shell

2894 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2895 /// Expand a pathname getting rid of special shell characaters like ~.$, etc.
2896 
2897 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::ExpandPathName(TString &patbuf0)
2898 {
2899  const char *patbuf = (const char *)patbuf0;
2900  const char *p;
2901  char *cmd = 0;
2902  char *q;
2903 
2904  Int_t old_level = gErrorIgnoreLevel;
2905  gErrorIgnoreLevel = kFatal; // Explicitly remove all messages
2906  if (patbuf0.BeginsWith("\\")) {
2907  const char driveletter = DriveName(patbuf);
2908  if (driveletter) {
2909  patbuf0.Prepend(":");
2910  patbuf0.Prepend(driveletter);
2911  }
2912  }
2913  TUrl urlpath(patbuf0, kTRUE);
2914  TString proto = urlpath.GetProtocol();
2915  gErrorIgnoreLevel = old_level;
2916  if (!proto.EqualTo("file")) // don't expand urls!!!
2917  return kFALSE;
2918 
2919  // skip the "file:" protocol, if any
2920  if (patbuf0.BeginsWith("file:"))
2921  patbuf += 5;
2922 
2923  // skip leading blanks
2924  while (*patbuf == ' ') {
2925  patbuf++;
2926  }
2927 
2928  // skip leading ':'
2929  while (*patbuf == ':') {
2930  patbuf++;
2931  }
2932 
2933  // skip leading ';'
2934  while (*patbuf == ';') {
2935  patbuf++;
2936  }
2937 
2938  // Transform a Unix list of directories into a Windows list
2939  // by changing the separator from ':' into ';'
2940  for (q = (char*)patbuf; *q; q++) {
2941  if ( *q == ':' ) {
2942  // We are avoiding substitution in the case of
2943  // ....;c:.... and of ...;root:/... where root can be any url protocol
2944  if ( (((q-2)>patbuf) && ( (*(q-2)!=';') || !isalpha(*(q-1)) )) &&
2945  *(q+1)!='/' ) {
2946  *q=';';
2947  }
2948  }
2949  }
2950  // any shell meta characters ?
2951  for (p = patbuf; *p; p++) {
2952  if (strchr(shellMeta, *p)) {
2953  goto needshell;
2954  }
2955  }
2956  return kFALSE;
2957 
2958 needshell:
2959 
2960  // Because (problably) we built with cygwin, the path name like:
2961  // LOCALS~1\\Temp
2962  // gets extended to
2963  // LOCALSc:\\Devel
2964  // The most likely cause is that '~' is used with Unix semantic of the
2965  // home directory (and it also cuts the path short after ... who knows why!)
2966  // So we need to detect this case and prevents its expansion :(.
2967 
2968  char replacement[4];
2969 
2970  // intentionally a non visible, unlikely character
2971  for (int k = 0; k<3; k++) replacement[k] = 0x1;
2972 
2973  replacement[3] = 0x0;
2974  Ssiz_t pos = 0;
2975  TRegexp TildaNum = "~[0-9]";
2976 
2977  while ( (pos = patbuf0.Index(TildaNum,pos)) != kNPOS ) {
2978  patbuf0.Replace(pos, 1, replacement);
2979  }
2980 
2981  // escape shell quote characters
2982  // EscChar(patbuf, stuffedPat, sizeof(stuffedPat), shellStuff, shellEscape);
2983  ExpandFileName(patbuf0);
2984  Int_t lbuf = ::ExpandEnvironmentStrings(
2985  patbuf0.Data(), // pointer to string with environment variables
2986  cmd, // pointer to string with expanded environment variables
2987  0 // maximum characters in expanded string
2988  );
2989  if (lbuf > 0) {
2990  cmd = new char[lbuf+1];
2991  ::ExpandEnvironmentStrings(
2992  patbuf0.Data(), // pointer to string with environment variables
2993  cmd, // pointer to string with expanded environment variables
2994  lbuf // maximum characters in expanded string
2995  );
2996  patbuf0 = cmd;
2997  patbuf0.ReplaceAll(replacement, "~");
2998  delete [] cmd;
2999  return kFALSE;
3000  }
3001  return kTRUE;
3002 }

3004 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3005 /// Expand a pathname getting rid of special shell characaters like ~.$, etc.
3006 /// User must delete returned string.
3007 
3008 char *TWinNTSystem::ExpandPathName(const char *path)
3009 {
3010  char newpath[MAX_PATH];
3011  if (IsShortcut(path)) {
3012  if (!ResolveShortCut(path, newpath, MAX_PATH))
3013  strlcpy(newpath, path, MAX_PATH);
3014  }
3015  else
3016  strlcpy(newpath, path, MAX_PATH);
3017  TString patbuf = newpath;
3018  if (ExpandPathName(patbuf)) return 0;
3019 
3020  return StrDup(patbuf.Data());
3021 }

3046 int TWinNTSystem::Utime(const char *file, Long_t modtime, Long_t actime)

3060 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3061 /// Find location of file in a search path.
3062 /// User must delete returned string. Returns 0 in case file is not found.
3063 
3064 const char *TWinNTSystem::FindFile(const char *search, TString& infile, EAccessMode mode)
3065 {
3066  // Windows cannot check on execution mode - all we can do is kReadPermission
3067  if (mode==kExecutePermission)
3068  mode=kReadPermission;
3069 
3070  // Expand parameters
3071 
3072  gSystem->ExpandPathName(infile);
3073  // Check whether this infile has the absolute path first
3074  if (IsAbsoluteFileName(infile.Data()) ) {
3075  if (!AccessPathName(infile.Data(), mode))
3076  return infile.Data();
3077  infile = "";
3078  return 0;
3079  }
3080  TString exsearch(search);
3081  gSystem->ExpandPathName(exsearch);
3082 
3083  // Need to use Windows delimiters
3084  Int_t lastDelim = -1;
3085  for(int i=0; i < exsearch.Length(); ++i) {
3086  switch( exsearch[i] ) {
3087  case ':':
3088  // Replace the ':' unless there are after a disk suffix (aka ;c:\mydirec...)
3089  if (i-lastDelim!=2) exsearch[i] = ';';
3090  lastDelim = i;
3091  break;
3092  case ';': lastDelim = i; break;
3093  }
3094  }
3095 
3096  // Check access
3097  struct stat finfo;
3098  char name[kMAXPATHLEN];
3099  char *lpFilePart = 0;
3100  if (::SearchPath(exsearch.Data(), infile.Data(), NULL, kMAXPATHLEN, name, &lpFilePart) &&
3101  ::access(name, mode) == 0 && stat(name, &finfo) == 0 &&
3102  finfo.st_mode & S_IFREG) {
3103  if (gEnv->GetValue("Root.ShowPath", 0)) {
3104  Printf("Which: %s = %s", infile, name);
3105  }
3106  infile = name;
3107  return infile.Data();
3108  }
3109  infile = "";
3110  return 0;
3111 }

3118 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::InitUsersGroups()
3119 {

3122  fActUser = -1;

3130  p2NetLocalGroupEnum = (pfn4)::GetProcAddress(netapi, "NetLocalGroupEnum");
3131

3138  for(int i=0;i<fNbGroups;i++) {
3139  fGroups[i].gr_mem = (char **)calloc(fNbUsers, sizeof (char*));
3140  }
3141  fPasswords = (struct passwd *)calloc(fNbUsers, sizeof(struct passwd));
3142 
3143  CollectGroups();
3144  ::FreeLibrary(netapi);

3150 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3151 
3152 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::CountMembers(const char *lpszGroupName)
3153 {
3154  NET_API_STATUS NetStatus = NERR_Success;
3155  LPBYTE Data = NULL;
3156  DWORD Index = 0, ResumeHandle = 0, Total = 0;
3157  LOCALGROUP_MEMBERS_INFO_1 *MemberInfo;
3158  WCHAR wszGroupName[256];
3159  int iRetOp = 0;
3160  DWORD dwLastError = 0;
3161 
3162  iRetOp = MultiByteToWideChar (
3163  (UINT)CP_ACP, // code page
3164  (DWORD)MB_PRECOMPOSED, // character-type options
3165  (LPCSTR)lpszGroupName, // address of string to map
3166  (int)-1, // number of bytes in string
3167  (LPWSTR)wszGroupName, // address of wide-character buffer
3168  (int)sizeof(wszGroupName) ); // size of buffer
3169 
3170  if (iRetOp == 0) {
3171  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3172  if (Data)
3173  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3174  return FALSE;
3175  }
3176 
3177  // The NetLocalGroupGetMembers() API retrieves a list of the members
3178  // of a particular local group.
3179  NetStatus = p2NetLocalGroupGetMembers (NULL, wszGroupName, 1,
3180  &Data, 8192, &Index, &Total, &ResumeHandle );
3181 
3182  if (NetStatus != NERR_Success || Data == NULL) {
3183  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3184 
3185  if (dwLastError == ERROR_ENVVAR_NOT_FOUND) {
3186  // This usually means that the current Group has no members.
3187  // We call NetLocalGroupGetMembers() again.
3188  // This time, we set the level to 0.
3189  // We do this just to confirm that the number of members in
3190  // this group is zero.
3191  NetStatus = p2NetLocalGroupGetMembers ( NULL, wszGroupName, 0,
3192  &Data, 8192, &Index, &Total, &ResumeHandle );
3193  }
3194 
3195  if (Data)
3196  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3197  return FALSE;
3198  }
3199 
3200  fNbUsers += Total;
3201  MemberInfo = (LOCALGROUP_MEMBERS_INFO_1 *)Data;
3202 
3203  if (Data)
3204  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3205 
3206  return TRUE;
3207 }

3209 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3210 
3211 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::GetNbGroups()
3212 {
3213  NET_API_STATUS NetStatus = NERR_Success;
3214  LPBYTE Data = NULL;
3215  DWORD Index = 0, ResumeHandle = 0, Total = 0, i;
3216  LOCALGROUP_INFO_0 *GroupInfo;
3217  char szAnsiName[256];
3218  DWORD dwLastError = 0;
3219  int iRetOp = 0;
3220 
3221  NetStatus = p2NetLocalGroupEnum(NULL, 0, &Data, 8192, &Index,
3222  &Total, &ResumeHandle );
3223 
3224  if (NetStatus != NERR_Success || Data == NULL) {
3225  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3226  if (Data)
3227  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3228  return FALSE;
3229  }
3230 
3231  fNbGroups = Total;
3232  GroupInfo = (LOCALGROUP_INFO_0 *)Data;
3233  for (i=0; i < Total; i++) {
3234  // Convert group name from UNICODE to ansi.
3235  iRetOp = WideCharToMultiByte (
3236  (UINT)CP_ACP, // code page
3237  (DWORD)0, // performance and mapping flags
3238  (LPCWSTR)(GroupInfo->lgrpi0_name), // address of wide-char string
3239  (int)-1, // number of characters in string
3240  (LPSTR)szAnsiName, // address of buffer for new string
3241  (int)(sizeof(szAnsiName)), // size of buffer
3242  (LPCSTR)NULL, // address of default for unmappable characters
3243  (LPBOOL)NULL ); // address of flag set when default char used.
3244 
3245  // Now lookup all members of this group and record down their names and
3246  // SIDs into the output file.
3247  CountMembers((LPCTSTR)szAnsiName);
3248 
3249  GroupInfo++;
3250  }
3251 
3252  if (Data)
3253  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3254 
3255  return TRUE;
3256 }
3257 
3258 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3259 ///
3260 /// Take the name and look up a SID so that we can get full
3261 /// domain/user information
3262 ///
3263 
3264 Long_t TWinNTSystem::LookupSID (const char *lpszAccountName, int what,
3265  int &groupIdx, int &memberIdx)
3266 {
3267  BOOL bRetOp = FALSE;
3268  PSID pSid = NULL;
3269  DWORD dwSidSize, dwDomainNameSize;
3270  BYTE bySidBuffer[MAX_SID_SIZE];
3271  char szDomainName[MAX_NAME_STRING];
3272  SID_NAME_USE sidType;
3273  PUCHAR puchar_SubAuthCount = NULL;
3274  SID_IDENTIFIER_AUTHORITY sid_identifier_authority;
3275  PSID_IDENTIFIER_AUTHORITY psid_identifier_authority = NULL;
3276  unsigned char j = 0;
3277  DWORD dwLastError = 0;
3278 
3279  pSid = (PSID)bySidBuffer;
3280  dwSidSize = sizeof(bySidBuffer);
3281  dwDomainNameSize = sizeof(szDomainName);
3282 
3283  bRetOp = LookupAccountName (
3284  (LPCTSTR)NULL, // address of string for system name
3285  (LPCTSTR)lpszAccountName, // address of string for account name
3286  (PSID)pSid, // address of security identifier
3287  (LPDWORD)&dwSidSize, // address of size of security identifier
3288  (LPTSTR)szDomainName, // address of string for referenced domain
3289  (LPDWORD)&dwDomainNameSize,// address of size of domain string
3290  (PSID_NAME_USE)&sidType ); // address of SID-type indicator
3291 
3292  if (bRetOp == FALSE) {
3293  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3294  return -1; // Unable to obtain Account SID.
3295  }
3296 
3297  bRetOp = IsValidSid((PSID)pSid);
3298 
3299  if (bRetOp == FALSE) {
3300  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3301  return -2; // SID returned is invalid.
3302  }
3303 
3304  // Obtain via APIs the identifier authority value.
3305  psid_identifier_authority = GetSidIdentifierAuthority ((PSID)pSid);
3306 
3307  // Make a copy of it.
3308  memcpy (&sid_identifier_authority, psid_identifier_authority,
3309  sizeof(SID_IDENTIFIER_AUTHORITY));
3310 
3311  // Determine how many sub-authority values there are in the current SID.
3312  puchar_SubAuthCount = (PUCHAR)GetSidSubAuthorityCount((PSID)pSid);
3313  // Assign it to a more convenient variable.
3314  j = (unsigned char)(*puchar_SubAuthCount);
3315  // Now obtain all the sub-authority values from the current SID.
3316  DWORD dwSubAuth = 0;
3317  PDWORD pdwSubAuth = NULL;
3318  // Obtain the current sub-authority DWORD (referenced by a pointer)
3319  pdwSubAuth = (PDWORD)GetSidSubAuthority (
3320  (PSID)pSid, // address of security identifier to query
3321  (DWORD)j-1); // index of subauthority to retrieve
3322  dwSubAuth = *pdwSubAuth;
3323  if(what == SID_MEMBER) {
3324  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_uid = dwSubAuth;
3325  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_gid = fGroups[groupIdx].gr_gid;
3326  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_group = strdup(fGroups[groupIdx].gr_name);
3327  }
3328  else if(what == SID_GROUP) {
3329  fGroups[groupIdx].gr_gid = dwSubAuth;
3330  }
3331  return 0;
3332 }
3333 
3334 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3335 ///
3336 
3337 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::CollectMembers(const char *lpszGroupName, int &groupIdx,
3338  int &memberIdx)
3339 {
3340 
3341  NET_API_STATUS NetStatus = NERR_Success;
3342  LPBYTE Data = NULL;
3343  DWORD Index = 0, ResumeHandle = 0, Total = 0, i;
3344  LOCALGROUP_MEMBERS_INFO_1 *MemberInfo;
3345  char szAnsiMemberName[256];
3346  char szFullMemberName[256];
3347  char szMemberHomeDir[256];
3348  WCHAR wszGroupName[256];
3349  int iRetOp = 0;
3350  char act_name[256];
3351  DWORD length = sizeof (act_name);
3352  DWORD dwLastError = 0;
3353  LPUSER_INFO_11 pUI11Buf = NULL;
3354  NET_API_STATUS nStatus;
3355 
3356  iRetOp = MultiByteToWideChar (
3357  (UINT)CP_ACP, // code page
3358  (DWORD)MB_PRECOMPOSED, // character-type options
3359  (LPCSTR)lpszGroupName, // address of string to map
3360  (int)-1, // number of bytes in string
3361  (LPWSTR)wszGroupName, // address of wide-character buffer
3362  (int)sizeof(wszGroupName) ); // size of buffer
3363 
3364  if (iRetOp == 0) {
3365  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3366  if (Data)
3367  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3368  return FALSE;
3369  }
3370 
3371  GetUserName (act_name, &length);
3372 
3373  // The NetLocalGroupGetMembers() API retrieves a list of the members
3374  // of a particular local group.
3375  NetStatus = p2NetLocalGroupGetMembers (NULL, wszGroupName, 1,
3376  &Data, 8192, &Index, &Total, &ResumeHandle );
3377 
3378  if (NetStatus != NERR_Success || Data == NULL) {
3379  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3380 
3381  if (dwLastError == ERROR_ENVVAR_NOT_FOUND) {
3382  // This usually means that the current Group has no members.
3383  // We call NetLocalGroupGetMembers() again.
3384  // This time, we set the level to 0.
3385  // We do this just to confirm that the number of members in
3386  // this group is zero.
3387  NetStatus = p2NetLocalGroupGetMembers ( NULL, wszGroupName, 0,
3388  &Data, 8192, &Index, &Total, &ResumeHandle );
3389  }
3390 
3391  if (Data)
3392  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3393  return FALSE;
3394  }
3395 
3396  MemberInfo = (LOCALGROUP_MEMBERS_INFO_1 *)Data;
3397  for (i=0; i < Total; i++) {
3398  iRetOp = WideCharToMultiByte (
3399  (UINT)CP_ACP, // code page
3400  (DWORD)0, // performance and mapping flags
3401  (LPCWSTR)(MemberInfo->lgrmi1_name), // address of wide-char string
3402  (int)-1, // number of characters in string
3403  (LPSTR)szAnsiMemberName, // address of buffer for new string
3404  (int)(sizeof(szAnsiMemberName)), // size of buffer
3405  (LPCSTR)NULL, // address of default for unmappable characters
3406  (LPBOOL)NULL ); // address of flag set when default char used.
3407 
3408  if (iRetOp == 0) {
3409  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3410  }
3411 
3412  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_name = strdup(szAnsiMemberName);
3413  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_passwd = strdup("");
3414  fGroups[groupIdx].gr_mem[i] = strdup(szAnsiMemberName);
3415 
3416  if(fActUser == -1 && !stricmp(fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_name,act_name))
3417  fActUser = memberIdx;
3418 
3419 
3420  TCHAR szUserName[255]=TEXT("");
3421  MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, szAnsiMemberName, -1, (LPWSTR)szUserName, 255);
3422  //
3423  // Call the NetUserGetInfo function; specify level 10.
3424  //
3425  nStatus = p2NetUserGetInfo(NULL, (LPCWSTR)szUserName, 11, (LPBYTE *)&pUI11Buf);
3426  //
3427  // If the call succeeds, print the user information.
3428  //
3429  if (nStatus == NERR_Success) {
3430  if (pUI11Buf != NULL) {
3431  wsprintf(szFullMemberName,"%S",pUI11Buf->usri11_full_name);
3432  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_gecos = strdup(szFullMemberName);
3433  wsprintf(szMemberHomeDir,"%S",pUI11Buf->usri11_home_dir);
3434  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_dir = strdup(szMemberHomeDir);
3435  }
3436  }
3437  if((fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_gecos == NULL) || (strlen(fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_gecos) == 0))
3438  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_gecos = strdup(fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_name);
3439  if((fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_dir == NULL) || (strlen(fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_dir) == 0))
3440  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_dir = strdup("c:\\");
3441  //
3442  // Free the allocated memory.
3443  //
3444  if (pUI11Buf != NULL) {
3445  p2NetApiBufferFree(pUI11Buf);
3446  pUI11Buf = NULL;
3447  }
3448 
3449  /* Ensure SHELL is defined. */
3450  if (getenv("SHELL") == NULL)
3451  putenv ((GetVersion () & 0x80000000) ? "SHELL=command" : "SHELL=cmd");
3452 
3453  /* Set dir and shell from environment variables. */
3454  fPasswords[memberIdx].pw_shell = getenv("SHELL");
3455 
3456  // Find out the SID of the Member.
3457  LookupSID ((LPCTSTR)szAnsiMemberName, SID_MEMBER, groupIdx, memberIdx);
3458  memberIdx++;
3459  MemberInfo++;
3460  }
3461  if(fActUser == -1) fActUser = 0;
3462 
3463  if (Data)
3464  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3465 
3466  return TRUE;
3467 }
3468 
3469 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3470 ///
3471 
3472 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::CollectGroups()
3473 {
3474  NET_API_STATUS NetStatus = NERR_Success;
3475  LPBYTE Data = NULL;
3476  DWORD Index = 0, ResumeHandle = 0, Total = 0, i;
3477  LOCALGROUP_INFO_0 *GroupInfo;
3478  char szAnsiName[256];
3479  DWORD dwLastError = 0;
3480  int iRetOp = 0, iGroupIdx = 0, iMemberIdx = 0;
3481 
3482  NetStatus = p2NetLocalGroupEnum(NULL, 0, &Data, 8192, &Index,
3483  &Total, &ResumeHandle );
3484 
3485  if (NetStatus != NERR_Success || Data == NULL) {
3486  dwLastError = GetLastError();
3487  if (Data)
3488  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3489  return FALSE;
3490  }
3491 
3492  GroupInfo = (LOCALGROUP_INFO_0 *)Data;
3493  for (i=0; i < Total; i++) {
3494  // Convert group name from UNICODE to ansi.
3495  iRetOp = WideCharToMultiByte (
3496  (UINT)CP_ACP, // code page
3497  (DWORD)0, // performance and mapping flags
3498  (LPCWSTR)(GroupInfo->lgrpi0_name), // address of wide-char string
3499  (int)-1, // number of characters in string
3500  (LPSTR)szAnsiName, // address of buffer for new string
3501  (int)(sizeof(szAnsiName)), // size of buffer
3502  (LPCSTR)NULL, // address of default for unmappable characters
3503  (LPBOOL)NULL ); // address of flag set when default char used.
3504 
3505  fGroups[iGroupIdx].gr_name = strdup(szAnsiName);
3506  fGroups[iGroupIdx].gr_passwd = strdup("");
3507 
3508  // Find out the SID of the Group.
3509  LookupSID ((LPCTSTR)szAnsiName, SID_GROUP, iGroupIdx, iMemberIdx);
3510  // Now lookup all members of this group and record down their names and
3511  // SIDs into the output file.
3512  CollectMembers((LPCTSTR)szAnsiName, iGroupIdx, iMemberIdx);
3513 
3514  iGroupIdx++;
3515  GroupInfo++;
3516  }
3517 
3518  if (Data)
3519  p2NetApiBufferFree(Data);
3520 
3521  return TRUE;
3522 }

3524 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3525 /// Returns the user's id. If user = 0, returns current user's id.
3526 
3527 Int_t TWinNTSystem::GetUid(const char *user)
3528 {
3529  if(!fGroupsInitDone)
3530  InitUsersGroups();
3531 
3532  // Net* API functions not allowed or OS not Windows NT/2000/XP
3533  if ((!gEnv->GetValue("WinNT.UseNetAPI", 0)) || (::GetVersion() >= 0x80000000)) {
3534  int uid;
3535  char name[256];
3536  DWORD length = sizeof (name);
3537  if (::GetUserName (name, &length)) {
3538  if (stricmp ("administrator", name) == 0)
3539  uid = 0;
3540  else
3541  uid = 123;
3542  }
3543  else {
3544  uid = 123;
3545  }
3546  return uid;
3547  }
3548  if (!user || !user[0])
3549  return fPasswords[fActUser].pw_uid;
3550  else {
3551  struct passwd *pwd = 0;
3552  for(int i=0;i<fNbUsers;i++) {
3553  if (!stricmp (user, fPasswords[i].pw_name)) {
3554  pwd = &fPasswords[i];
3555  break;
3556  }
3557  }
3558  if (pwd)
3559  return pwd->pw_uid;
3560  }
3561  return 0;
3562 }

3660 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3661 /// Returns all user info in the UserGroup_t structure. The returned
3662 /// structure must be deleted by the user. In case of error 0 is returned.
3663 
3664 UserGroup_t *TWinNTSystem::GetUserInfo(Int_t uid)
3665 {
3666  if(!fGroupsInitDone)
3667  InitUsersGroups();
3668 
3669  // Net* API functions not allowed or OS not Windows NT/2000/XP
3670  if ((!gEnv->GetValue("WinNT.UseNetAPI", 0)) || (::GetVersion() >= 0x80000000)) {
3671  char name[256];
3672  DWORD length = sizeof (name);
3673  UserGroup_t *ug = new UserGroup_t;
3674  if (::GetUserName (name, &length)) {
3675  ug->fUser = name;
3676  if (stricmp ("administrator", name) == 0) {
3677  ug->fUid = 0;
3678  ug->fGroup = "administrators";
3679  }
3680  else {
3681  ug->fUid = 123;
3682  ug->fGroup = "users";
3683  }
3684  ug->fGid = ug->fUid;
3685  }
3686  else {
3687  ug->fUser = "unknown";
3688  ug->fGroup = "unknown";
3689  ug->fUid = ug->fGid = 123;
3690  }
3691  ug->fPasswd = "";
3692  ug->fRealName = ug->fUser;
3693  ug->fShell = "command";
3694  return ug;
3695  }
3696  struct passwd *pwd = 0;
3697  if (uid == 0)
3698  pwd = &fPasswords[fActUser];
3699  else {
3700  for (int i = 0; i < fNbUsers; i++) {
3701  if (uid == fPasswords[i].pw_uid) {
3702  pwd = &fPasswords[i];
3703  break;
3704  }
3705  }
3706  }
3707  if (pwd) {
3708  UserGroup_t *ug = new UserGroup_t;
3709  ug->fUid = pwd->pw_uid;
3710  ug->fGid = pwd->pw_gid;
3711  ug->fUser = pwd->pw_name;
3712  ug->fPasswd = pwd->pw_passwd;
3713  ug->fRealName = pwd->pw_gecos;
3714  ug->fShell = pwd->pw_shell;
3715  ug->fGroup = pwd->pw_group;
3716  return ug;
3717  }
3718  return 0;
3719 }

3723 /// current user's id info. The returned structure must be deleted by the
3724 /// user. In case of error 0 is returned.
3725 
3726 UserGroup_t *TWinNTSystem::GetUserInfo(const char *user)

3731 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3732 /// Returns all group info in the UserGroup_t structure. The only active
3733 /// fields in the UserGroup_t structure for this call are:
3734 /// fGid and fGroup
3735 /// The returned structure must be deleted by the user. In case of
3736 /// error 0 is returned.
3737 
3738 UserGroup_t *TWinNTSystem::GetGroupInfo(Int_t gid)
3739 {
3740  if(!fGroupsInitDone)
3741  InitUsersGroups();
3742 
3743  // Net* API functions not allowed or OS not Windows NT/2000/XP
3744  if ((!gEnv->GetValue("WinNT.UseNetAPI", 0)) || (::GetVersion() >= 0x80000000)) {
3745  char name[256];
3746  DWORD length = sizeof (name);
3747  UserGroup_t *gr = new UserGroup_t;
3748  if (::GetUserName (name, &length)) {
3749  if (stricmp ("administrator", name) == 0) {
3750  gr->fGroup = "administrators";
3751  gr->fGid = 0;
3752  }
3753  else {
3754  gr->fGroup = "users";
3755  gr->fGid = 123;
3756  }
3757  }
3758  else {
3759  gr->fGroup = "unknown";
3760  gr->fGid = 123;
3761  }
3762  gr->fUid = 0;
3763  return gr;
3764  }
3765  struct group *grp = 0;
3766  for(int i=0;i<fNbGroups;i++) {
3767  if (gid == fGroups[i].gr_gid) {
3768  grp = &fGroups[i];
3769  break;
3770  }
3771  }
3772  if (grp) {
3773  UserGroup_t *gr = new UserGroup_t;
3774  gr->fUid = 0;
3775  gr->fGid = grp->gr_gid;
3776  gr->fGroup = grp->gr_name;
3777  return gr;
3778  }
3779  return 0;
3780 
3781 }

3863 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3864 /// Exit the application.
3865 
3866 void TWinNTSystem::Exit(int code, Bool_t mode)
3867 {
3868  // Insures that the files and sockets are closed before any library is unloaded
3869  // and before emptying CINT.
3870  if (gROOT) {
3871  gROOT->CloseFiles();
3872  if (gROOT->GetListOfBrowsers()) {
3873  // GetListOfBrowsers()->Delete() creates problems when a browser is
3874  // created on the stack, calling CloseWindow() solves the problem
3875  if (gROOT->IsBatch())
3876  gROOT->GetListOfBrowsers()->Delete();
3877  else {
3878  TBrowser *b;
3879  TIter next(gROOT->GetListOfBrowsers());
3880  while ((b = (TBrowser*) next()))
3881  gROOT->ProcessLine(TString::Format("\
3882  if (((TBrowser*)0x%lx)->GetBrowserImp() &&\
3883  ((TBrowser*)0x%lx)->GetBrowserImp()->GetMainFrame()) \
3884  ((TBrowser*)0x%lx)->GetBrowserImp()->GetMainFrame()->CloseWindow();\
3885  else delete (TBrowser*)0x%lx", (ULong_t)b, (ULong_t)b, (ULong_t)b, (ULong_t)b));
3886  }
3887  }
3888  gROOT->EndOfProcessCleanups();
3889  }
3890  if (gInterpreter) {
3891  gInterpreter->ResetGlobals();
3892  }
3893  gVirtualX->CloseDisplay();
3894 
3895  if (mode) {
3896  ::exit(code);
3897  } else {
3898  ::_exit(code);
3899  }
3900 }

3911 
3912 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3913 /// Redirect standard output (stdout, stderr) to the specified file.
3914 /// If the file argument is 0 the output is set again to stderr, stdout.
3915 /// The second argument specifies whether the output should be added to the
3916 /// file ("a", default) or the file be truncated before ("w").
3917 /// This function saves internally the current state into a static structure.
3918 /// The call can be made reentrant by specifying the opaque structure pointed
3919 /// by 'h', which is filled with the relevant information. The handle 'h'
3920 /// obtained on the first call must then be used in any subsequent call,
3921 /// included ShowOutput, to display the redirected output.
3922 /// Returns 0 on success, -1 in case of error.
3923 
3924 Int_t TWinNTSystem::RedirectOutput(const char *file, const char *mode,
3925  RedirectHandle_t *h)
3926 {
3927  FILE *fout, *ferr;
3928  static int fd1=0, fd2=0;
3929  static fpos_t pos1=0, pos2=0;
3930  // Instance to be used if the caller does not passes 'h'
3931  static RedirectHandle_t loch;
3932  Int_t rc = 0;
3933 
3934  // Which handle to use ?
3935  RedirectHandle_t *xh = (h) ? h : &loch;
3936 
3937  if (file) {
3938  // Make sure mode makes sense; default "a"
3939  const char *m = (mode[0] == 'a' || mode[0] == 'w') ? mode : "a";
3940 
3941  // Current file size
3942  xh->fReadOffSet = 0;
3943  if (m[0] == 'a') {
3944  // If the file exists, save the current size
3945  FileStat_t st;
3946  if (!gSystem->GetPathInfo(file, st))
3947  xh->fReadOffSet = (st.fSize > 0) ? st.fSize : xh->fReadOffSet;
3948  }
3949  xh->fFile = file;
3950 
3951  fflush(stdout);
3952  fgetpos(stdout, &pos1);
3953  fd1 = _dup(fileno(stdout));
3954  // redirect stdout & stderr
3955  if ((fout = freopen(file, m, stdout)) == 0) {
3956  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not freopen stdout");
3957  if (fd1 > 0) {
3958  _dup2(fd1, fileno(stdout));
3959  close(fd1);
3960  }
3961  clearerr(stdout);
3962  fsetpos(stdout, &pos1);
3963  fd1 = fd2 = 0;
3964  return -1;
3965  }
3966  fflush(stderr);
3967  fgetpos(stderr, &pos2);
3968  fd2 = _dup(fileno(stderr));
3969  if ((ferr = freopen(file, m, stderr)) == 0) {
3970  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not freopen stderr");
3971  if (fd1 > 0) {
3972  _dup2(fd1, fileno(stdout));
3973  close(fd1);
3974  }
3975  clearerr(stdout);
3976  fsetpos(stdout, &pos1);
3977  if (fd2 > 0) {
3978  _dup2(fd2, fileno(stderr));
3979  close(fd2);
3980  }
3981  clearerr(stderr);
3982  fsetpos(stderr, &pos2);
3983  fd1 = fd2 = 0;
3984  return -1;
3985  }
3986  if (m[0] == 'a') {
3987  fseek(fout, 0, SEEK_END);
3988  fseek(ferr, 0, SEEK_END);
3989  }
3990  } else {
3991  // Restore stdout & stderr
3992  fflush(stdout);
3993  if (fd1) {
3994  if (fd1 > 0) {
3995  if (_dup2(fd1, fileno(stdout))) {
3996  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stdout");
3997  rc = -1;
3998  }
3999  close(fd1);
4000  }
4001  clearerr(stdout);
4002  fsetpos(stdout, &pos1);
4003  fd1 = 0;
4004  }
4005 
4006  fflush(stderr);
4007  if (fd2) {
4008  if (fd2 > 0) {
4009  if (_dup2(fd2, fileno(stderr))) {
4010  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stderr");
4011  rc = -1;
4012  }
4013  close(fd2);
4014  }
4015  clearerr(stderr);
4016  fsetpos(stderr, &pos2);
4017  fd2 = 0;
4018  }
4019 
4020  // Reset the static instance, if using that
4021  if (xh == &loch)
4022  xh->Reset();
4023  }
4024  return rc;
4025 }

4063 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4064 /// Returns and updates sLib to the path of a dynamic library
4065 /// (searches for library in the dynamic library search path).
4066 /// If no file name extension is provided it tries .DLL.
4067 
4068 const char *TWinNTSystem::FindDynamicLibrary(TString &sLib, Bool_t quiet)
4069 {
4070  int len = sLib.Length();
4071  if (len > 4 && (!stricmp(sLib.Data()+len-4, ".dll"))) {
4072  if (gSystem->FindFile(GetDynamicPath(), sLib, kReadPermission))
4073  return sLib;
4074  } else {
4075  TString sLibDll(sLib);
4076  sLibDll += ".dll";
4077  if (gSystem->FindFile(GetDynamicPath(), sLibDll, kReadPermission)) {
4078  sLibDll.Swap(sLib);
4079  return sLib;
4080  }
4081  }
4082 
4083  if (!quiet) {
4084  Error("DynamicPathName",
4085  "%s does not exist in %s,\nor has wrong file extension (.dll)",
4086  sLib.Data(), GetDynamicPath());
4087  }
4088  return 0;
4089 }

4100 
4101 /* nonstandard extension used : zero-sized array in struct/union */
4102 #pragma warning(push)
4103 #pragma warning(disable:4200)
4104 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4105 /// Get list of shared libraries loaded at the start of the executable.
4106 /// Returns 0 in case list cannot be obtained or in case of error.
4107 
4108 const char *TWinNTSystem::GetLinkedLibraries()
4109 {
4110  char winDrive[256];
4111  char winDir[256];
4112  char winName[256];
4113  char winExt[256];
4114 
4115  if (!gApplication) return 0;
4116 
4117  static Bool_t once = kFALSE;
4118  static TString linkedLibs;
4119 
4120  if (!linkedLibs.IsNull())
4121  return linkedLibs;
4122 
4123  if (once)
4124  return 0;
4125 
4126  char *exe = gSystem->Which(Getenv("PATH"), gApplication->Argv(0),
4127  kExecutePermission);
4128  if (!exe) {
4129  once = kTRUE;
4130  return 0;
4131  }
4132 
4133  HANDLE hFile, hMapping;
4134  void *basepointer;
4135 
4136  if((hFile = CreateFile(exe,GENERIC_READ,FILE_SHARE_READ,0,OPEN_EXISTING,FILE_FLAG_SEQUENTIAL_SCAN,0))==INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
4137  delete [] exe;
4138  return 0;
4139  }
4140  if(!(hMapping = CreateFileMapping(hFile,0,PAGE_READONLY|SEC_COMMIT,0,0,0))) {
4141  CloseHandle(hFile);
4142  delete [] exe;
4143  return 0;
4144  }
4145  if(!(basepointer = MapViewOfFile(hMapping,FILE_MAP_READ,0,0,0))) {
4146  CloseHandle(hMapping);
4147  CloseHandle(hFile);
4148  delete [] exe;
4149  return 0;
4150  }
4151 
4152  int sect;
4153  IMAGE_DOS_HEADER *dos_head = (IMAGE_DOS_HEADER *)basepointer;
4154  struct header {
4155  DWORD signature;
4156  IMAGE_FILE_HEADER _head;
4157  IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER opt_head;
4158  IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER section_header[]; // actual number in NumberOfSections
4159  };
4160  struct header *pheader;
4161  const IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER * section_header;
4162 
4163  if(dos_head->e_magic!='ZM') {
4164  delete [] exe;
4165  return 0;
4166  } // verify DOS-EXE-Header
4167  // after end of DOS-EXE-Header: offset to PE-Header
4168  pheader = (struct header *)((char*)dos_head + dos_head->e_lfanew);
4169 
4170  if(IsBadReadPtr(pheader,sizeof(struct header))) { // start of PE-Header
4171  delete [] exe;
4172  return 0;
4173  }
4174  if(pheader->signature!=IMAGE_NT_SIGNATURE) { // verify PE format
4175  switch((unsigned short)pheader->signature) {
4176  case IMAGE_DOS_SIGNATURE:
4177  delete [] exe;
4178  return 0;
4179  case IMAGE_OS2_SIGNATURE:
4180  delete [] exe;
4181  return 0;
4182  case IMAGE_OS2_SIGNATURE_LE:
4183  delete [] exe;
4184  return 0;
4185  default: // unknown signature
4186  delete [] exe;
4187  return 0;
4188  }
4189  }
4190 #define isin(address,start,length) ((address)>=(start) && (address)<(start)+(length))
4191  TString odump;
4192  // walk through sections
4193  for(sect=0,section_header=pheader->section_header;
4194  sect<pheader->_head.NumberOfSections;sect++,section_header++) {
4195  int directory;
4196  const void * const section_data =
4197  (char*)basepointer + section_header->PointerToRawData;
4198  for(directory=0;directory<IMAGE_NUMBEROF_DIRECTORY_ENTRIES;directory++) {
4199  if(isin(pheader->opt_head.DataDirectory[directory].VirtualAddress,
4200  section_header->VirtualAddress,
4201  section_header->SizeOfRawData)) {
4202  const IMAGE_IMPORT_DESCRIPTOR *stuff_start =
4203  (IMAGE_IMPORT_DESCRIPTOR *)((char*)section_data +
4204  (pheader->opt_head.DataDirectory[directory].VirtualAddress -
4205  section_header->VirtualAddress));
4206  // (virtual address of stuff - virtual address of section) =
4207  // offset of stuff in section
4208  const unsigned stuff_length =
4209  pheader->opt_head.DataDirectory[directory].Size;
4210  if(directory == IMAGE_DIRECTORY_ENTRY_IMPORT) {
4211  while(!IsBadReadPtr(stuff_start,sizeof(*stuff_start)) &&
4212  stuff_start->Name) {
4213  TString dll = (char*)section_data +
4214  ((DWORD)(stuff_start->Name)) -
4215  section_header->VirtualAddress;
4216  if (dll.EndsWith(".dll")) {
4217  char *dllPath = DynamicPathName(dll, kTRUE);
4218  if (dllPath) {
4219  char *winPath = getenv("windir");
4220  _splitpath(winPath,winDrive,winDir,winName,winExt);
4221  if(!strstr(dllPath, winDir)) {
4222  if (!linkedLibs.IsNull())
4223  linkedLibs += " ";
4224  linkedLibs += dllPath;
4225  }
4226  }
4227  delete [] dllPath;
4228  }
4229  stuff_start++;
4230  }
4231  }
4232  }
4233  }
4234  }
4235 
4236  UnmapViewOfFile(basepointer);
4237  CloseHandle(hMapping);
4238  CloseHandle(hFile);
4239 
4240  delete [] exe;
4241 
4242  once = kTRUE;
4243 
4244  if (linkedLibs.IsNull())
4245  return 0;
4246 
4247  return linkedLibs;
4248 }
4249 #pragma warning(pop)
4250 
4251 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4252 /// Return a space separated list of loaded shared libraries.
4253 /// This list is of a format suitable for a linker, i.e it may contain
4254 /// -Lpathname and/or -lNameOfLib.
4255 /// Option can be any of:
4256 /// S: shared libraries loaded at the start of the executable, because
4257 /// they were specified on the link line.
4258 /// D: shared libraries dynamically loaded after the start of the program.
4259 /// L: list the .LIB rather than the .DLL (this is intended for linking)
4260 /// [This options is not the default]
4261 
4262 const char *TWinNTSystem::GetLibraries(const char *regexp, const char *options,
4263  Bool_t isRegexp)
4264 {
4265  TString libs(TSystem::GetLibraries(regexp, options, isRegexp));
4266  TString ntlibs;
4267  TString opt = options;
4268 
4269  if ( (opt.First('L')!=kNPOS) ) {
4270  TRegexp separator("[^ \\t\\s]+");
4271  TRegexp user_dll("\\.dll$");
4272  TRegexp user_lib("\\.lib$");
4273  FileStat_t sbuf;
4274  TString s;
4275  Ssiz_t start, index, end;
4276  start = index = end = 0;
4277 
4278  while ((start < libs.Length()) && (index != kNPOS)) {
4279  index = libs.Index(separator, &end, start);
4280  if (index >= 0) {
4281  // Change .dll into .lib and remove the
4282  // path info if it not accessible.
4283  s = libs(index, end);
4284  if (s.Index(user_dll) != kNPOS) {
4285  s.ReplaceAll(".dll",".lib");
4286  if ( GetPathInfo( s, sbuf ) != 0 ) {
4287  s.Replace( 0, s.Last('/')+1, 0, 0);
4288  s.Replace( 0, s.Last('\\')+1, 0, 0);
4289  }
4290  } else if (s.Index(user_lib) != kNPOS) {
4291  if ( GetPathInfo( s, sbuf ) != 0 ) {
4292  s.Replace( 0, s.Last('/')+1, 0, 0);
4293  s.Replace( 0, s.Last('\\')+1, 0, 0);
4294  }
4295  }
4296  if (!ntlibs.IsNull()) ntlibs.Append(" ");
4297  ntlibs.Append(s);
4298  }
4299  start += end+1;
4300  }
4301  } else {
4302  ntlibs = libs;
4303  }
4304 
4305  fListLibs = ntlibs;
4306  fListLibs.ReplaceAll("/","\\");
4307  return fListLibs;
4308 }

4331 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4332 /// Special Thread to check asynchronous timers.
4333 
4334 void TWinNTSystem::TimerThread()
4335 {
4336  while (1) {
4337  if (!fInsideNotify)
4338  DispatchTimers(kFALSE);
4339  ::Sleep(kItimerResolution/2);
4340  }
4341 }
4342 
4343 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4344 /// Handle and dispatch timers. If mode = kTRUE dispatch synchronous
4345 /// timers else a-synchronous timers.
4346 
4347 Bool_t TWinNTSystem::DispatchTimers(Bool_t mode)
4348 {
4349  if (!fTimers) return kFALSE;
4350 
4351  fInsideNotify = kTRUE;
4352 
4353  TOrdCollectionIter it((TOrdCollection*)fTimers);
4354  TTimer *t;
4355  Bool_t timedout = kFALSE;
4356 
4357  while ((t = (TTimer *) it.Next())) {
4358  // NB: the timer resolution is added in TTimer::CheckTimer()
4359  TTime now = Now();
4360  if (mode && t->IsSync()) {
4361  if (t->CheckTimer(now)) {
4362  timedout = kTRUE;
4363  }
4364  } else if (!mode && t->IsAsync()) {
4365  if (t->CheckTimer(now)) {
4366  timedout = kTRUE;
4367  }
4368  }
4369  }
4370  fInsideNotify = kFALSE;
4371 
4372  return timedout;
4373 }
4374 
4375 const Double_t gTicks = 1.0e-7;
4376 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4377 ///
4378 
4379 Double_t TWinNTSystem::GetRealTime()
4380 {
4381  union {
4382  FILETIME ftFileTime;
4383  __int64 ftInt64;
4384  } ftRealTime; // time the process has spent in kernel mode
4385 
4386  ::GetSystemTimeAsFileTime(&ftRealTime.ftFileTime);
4387  return (Double_t)ftRealTime.ftInt64 * gTicks;
4388 }
4389 
4390 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4391 ///
4392 
4393 Double_t TWinNTSystem::GetCPUTime()
4394 {
4395  OSVERSIONINFO OsVersionInfo;
4396 
4397 //*-* Value Platform
4398 //*-* ----------------------------------------------------
4399 //*-* VER_PLATFORM_WIN32s Win32s on Windows 3.1
4400 //*-* VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_WINDOWS Win32 on Windows 95
4401 //*-* VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT Windows NT
4402 //*-*
4403 
4404  OsVersionInfo.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
4405  GetVersionEx(&OsVersionInfo);
4406  if (OsVersionInfo.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
4407  DWORD ret;
4408  FILETIME ftCreate, // when the process was created
4409  ftExit; // when the process exited
4410 
4411  union {
4412  FILETIME ftFileTime;
4413  __int64 ftInt64;
4414  } ftKernel; // time the process has spent in kernel mode
4415 
4416  union {
4417  FILETIME ftFileTime;
4418  __int64 ftInt64;
4419  } ftUser; // time the process has spent in user mode
4420 
4421  HANDLE hThread = GetCurrentThread();
4422  ret = GetThreadTimes (hThread, &ftCreate, &ftExit,
4423  &ftKernel.ftFileTime,
4424  &ftUser.ftFileTime);
4425  if (ret != TRUE){
4426  ret = ::GetLastError();
4427  ::Error("GetCPUTime", " Error on GetProcessTimes 0x%lx", (int)ret);
4428  }
4429 
4430  // Process times are returned in a 64-bit structure, as the number of
4431  // 100 nanosecond ticks since 1 January 1601. User mode and kernel mode
4432  // times for this process are in separate 64-bit structures.
4433  // To convert to floating point seconds, we will:
4434  // Convert sum of high 32-bit quantities to 64-bit int
4435 
4436  return (Double_t) (ftKernel.ftInt64 + ftUser.ftInt64) * gTicks;
4437  } else {
4438  return GetRealTime();
4439  }
4440 }
4441 
4442 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4443 /// Get current time in milliseconds since 0:00 Jan 1 1995.
4444 
4445 TTime TWinNTSystem::Now()
4446 {
4447  static time_t jan95 = 0;
4448  if (!jan95) {
4449  struct tm tp;
4450  tp.tm_year = 95;
4451  tp.tm_mon = 0;
4452  tp.tm_mday = 1;
4453  tp.tm_hour = 0;
4454  tp.tm_min = 0;
4455  tp.tm_sec = 0;
4456  tp.tm_isdst = -1;
4457 
4458  jan95 = mktime(&tp);
4459  if ((int)jan95 == -1) {
4460  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::Now", "error converting 950001 0:00 to time_t");
4461  return 0;
4462  }
4463  }
4464 
4465  _timeb now;
4466  _ftime(&now);
4467  return TTime((now.time-(Long_t)jan95)*1000 + now.millitm);
4468 }

4480 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4481 /// Select on file descriptors. The timeout to is in millisec.
4482 
4483 Int_t TWinNTSystem::Select(TList *act, Long_t to)
4484 {
4485  Int_t rc = -4;
4486 
4487  TFdSet rd, wr;
4488  Int_t mxfd = -1;
4489  TIter next(act);
4490  TFileHandler *h = 0;
4491  while ((h = (TFileHandler *) next())) {
4492  Int_t fd = h->GetFd();
4493  if (h->HasReadInterest())
4494  rd.Set(fd);
4495  if (h->HasWriteInterest())
4496  wr.Set(fd);
4497  h->ResetReadyMask();
4498  }
4499  rc = WinNTSelect(&rd, &wr, to);
4500 
4501  // Set readiness bits
4502  if (rc > 0) {
4503  next.Reset();
4504  while ((h = (TFileHandler *) next())) {
4505  Int_t fd = h->GetFd();
4506  if (rd.IsSet(fd))
4507  h->SetReadReady();
4508  if (wr.IsSet(fd))
4509  h->SetWriteReady();
4510  }
4511  }
4512 
4513  return rc;
4514 }
4515 
4516 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4517 /// Select on the file descriptor related to file handler h.
4518 /// The timeout to is in millisec.
4519 
4520 Int_t TWinNTSystem::Select(TFileHandler *h, Long_t to)
4521 {
4522  Int_t rc = -4;
4523 
4524  TFdSet rd, wr;
4525  Int_t fd = -1;
4526  if (h) {
4527  fd = h->GetFd();
4528  if (h->HasReadInterest())
4529  rd.Set(fd);
4530  if (h->HasWriteInterest())
4531  wr.Set(fd);
4532  h->ResetReadyMask();
4533  rc = WinNTSelect(&rd, &wr, to);
4534  }
4535 
4536  // Fill output lists, if required
4537  if (rc > 0) {
4538  if (rd.IsSet(fd))
4539  h->SetReadReady();
4540  if (wr.IsSet(fd))
4541  h->SetWriteReady();
4542  }
4543 
4544  return rc;
4545 }

4577 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4578 /// Get Internet Protocol (IP) address of host.
4579 
4580 TInetAddress TWinNTSystem::GetHostByName(const char *hostname)
4581 {
4582  struct hostent *host_ptr;
4583  const char *host;
4584  int type;
4585  UInt_t addr; // good for 4 byte addresses
4586 
4587  if ((addr = ::inet_addr(hostname)) != INADDR_NONE) {
4588  type = AF_INET;
4589  if ((host_ptr = ::gethostbyaddr((const char *)&addr,
4590  sizeof(addr), AF_INET))) {
4591  host = host_ptr->h_name;
4592  TInetAddress a(host, ntohl(addr), type);
4593  UInt_t addr2;
4594  Int_t i;
4595  for (i = 1; host_ptr->h_addr_list[i]; i++) {
4596  memcpy(&addr2, host_ptr->h_addr_list[i], host_ptr->h_length);
4597  a.AddAddress(ntohl(addr2));
4598  }
4599  for (i = 0; host_ptr->h_aliases[i]; i++)
4600  a.AddAlias(host_ptr->h_aliases[i]);
4601  return a;
4602  } else {
4603  host = "UnNamedHost";
4604  }
4605  } else if ((host_ptr = ::gethostbyname(hostname))) {
4606  // Check the address type for an internet host
4607  if (host_ptr->h_addrtype != AF_INET) {
4608  Error("GetHostByName", "%s is not an internet host\n", hostname);
4609  return TInetAddress();
4610  }
4611  memcpy(&addr, host_ptr->h_addr, host_ptr->h_length);
4612  host = host_ptr->h_name;
4613  type = host_ptr->h_addrtype;
4614  TInetAddress a(host, ntohl(addr), type);
4615  UInt_t addr2;
4616  Int_t i;
4617  for (i = 1; host_ptr->h_addr_list[i]; i++) {
4618  memcpy(&addr2, host_ptr->h_addr_list[i], host_ptr->h_length);
4619  a.AddAddress(ntohl(addr2));
4620  }
4621  for (i = 0; host_ptr->h_aliases[i]; i++)
4622  a.AddAlias(host_ptr->h_aliases[i]);
4623  return a;
4624  } else {
4625  if (gDebug > 0) Error("GetHostByName", "unknown host %s", hostname);
4626  return TInetAddress(hostname, 0, -1);
4627  }
4628 
4629  return TInetAddress(host, ::ntohl(addr), type);
4630 }

4632 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4633 /// Get Internet Protocol (IP) address of remote host and port #.
4634 
4635 TInetAddress TWinNTSystem::GetPeerName(int socket)
4636 {
4637  SOCKET sock = socket;
4638  struct sockaddr_in addr;
4639  int len = sizeof(addr);
4640 
4641  if (::getpeername(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&addr, &len) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4642  ::SysError("GetPeerName", "getpeername");
4643  return TInetAddress();
4644  }
4645 
4646  struct hostent *host_ptr;
4647  const char *hostname;
4648  int family;
4649  UInt_t iaddr;
4650 
4651  if ((host_ptr = ::gethostbyaddr((const char *)&addr.sin_addr,
4652  sizeof(addr.sin_addr), AF_INET))) {
4653  memcpy(&iaddr, host_ptr->h_addr, host_ptr->h_length);
4654  hostname = host_ptr->h_name;
4655  family = host_ptr->h_addrtype;
4656  } else {
4657  memcpy(&iaddr, &addr.sin_addr, sizeof(addr.sin_addr));
4658  hostname = "????";
4659  family = AF_INET;
4660  }
4661 
4662  return TInetAddress(hostname, ::ntohl(iaddr), family, ::ntohs(addr.sin_port));
4663 }

4698 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4699 /// Announce unix domain service.
4700 
4701 int TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService(int port, int backlog)
4702 {
4703  SOCKET sock;
4704 
4705  // Create socket
4706  if ((sock = ::socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == INVALID_SOCKET) {
4707  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "socket");
4708  return -1;
4709  }
4710 
4711  struct sockaddr_in inserver;
4712  memset(&inserver, 0, sizeof(inserver));
4713  inserver.sin_family = AF_INET;
4714  inserver.sin_addr.s_addr = ::htonl(INADDR_LOOPBACK);
4715  inserver.sin_port = port;
4716 
4717  // Bind socket
4718  if (port > 0) {
4719  if (::bind(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &inserver, sizeof(inserver)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4720  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "bind");
4721  return -2;
4722  }
4723  }
4724  // Start accepting connections
4725  if (::listen(sock, backlog)) {
4726  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "listen");
4727  return -1;
4728  }
4729  return (int)sock;
4730 }
4731 
4732 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4733 /// Open a socket on path 'sockpath', bind to it and start listening for Unix
4734 /// domain connections to it. Returns socket fd or -1.
4735 
4736 int TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService(const char *sockpath, int backlog)
4737 {
4738  if (!sockpath || strlen(sockpath) <= 0) {
4739  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "socket path undefined");
4740  return -1;
4741  }
4742 
4743  struct sockaddr_in myaddr;
4744  FILE * fp;
4745  int len = sizeof myaddr;
4746  int rc;
4747  int sock;
4748 
4749  // Create socket
4750  if ((sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0) {
4751  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "socket");
4752  return -1;
4753  }
4754 
4755  memset(&myaddr, 0, sizeof(myaddr));
4756  myaddr.sin_port = 0;
4757  myaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
4758  myaddr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_LOOPBACK);
4759 
4760  rc = bind(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&myaddr, len);
4761  if (rc) {
4762  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "bind");
4763  return rc;
4764  }
4765  rc = getsockname(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&myaddr, &len);
4766  if (rc) {
4767  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "getsockname");
4768  return rc;
4769  }
4770  TString socketpath = sockpath;
4771  socketpath.ReplaceAll("/", "\\");
4772  fp = fopen(socketpath, "wb");
4773  if (!fp) {
4774  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "fopen");
4775  return -1;
4776  }
4777  fprintf(fp, "%d", myaddr.sin_port);
4778  fclose(fp);
4779 
4780  // Start accepting connections
4781  if (listen(sock, backlog)) {
4782  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUnixService", "listen");
4783  return -1;
4784  }
4785 
4786  return sock;
4787 }

4789 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4790 /// Close socket.
4791 
4792 void TWinNTSystem::CloseConnection(int socket, Bool_t force)
4793 {
4794  if (socket == -1) return;
4795  SOCKET sock = socket;
4796 
4797  if (force) {
4798  ::shutdown(sock, 2);
4799  }
4800  struct linger linger = {0, 0};
4801  ::setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER, (char *) &linger, sizeof(linger));
4802  while (::closesocket(sock) == SOCKET_ERROR && WSAGetLastError() == WSAEINTR) {
4803  TSystem::ResetErrno();
4804  }
4805 }
4806 
4807 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4808 /// Receive a buffer headed by a length indicator. Length is the size of
4809 /// the buffer. Returns the number of bytes received in buf or -1 in
4810 /// case of error.
4811 
4812 int TWinNTSystem::RecvBuf(int sock, void *buf, int length)
4813 {
4814  Int_t header;
4815 
4816  if (WinNTRecv(sock, &header, sizeof(header), 0) > 0) {
4817  int count = ::ntohl(header);
4818 
4819  if (count > length) {
4820  Error("RecvBuf", "record header exceeds buffer size");
4821  return -1;
4822  } else if (count > 0) {
4823  if (WinNTRecv(sock, buf, count, 0) < 0) {
4824  Error("RecvBuf", "cannot receive buffer");
4825  return -1;
4826  }
4827  }
4828  return count;
4829  }
4830  return -1;
4831 }
4832 
4833 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4834 /// Send a buffer headed by a length indicator. Returns length of sent buffer
4835 /// or -1 in case of error.
4836 
4837 int TWinNTSystem::SendBuf(int sock, const void *buf, int length)
4838 {
4839  Int_t header = ::htonl(length);
4840 
4841  if (WinNTSend(sock, &header, sizeof(header), 0) < 0) {
4842  Error("SendBuf", "cannot send header");
4843  return -1;
4844  }
4845  if (length > 0) {
4846  if (WinNTSend(sock, buf, length, 0) < 0) {
4847  Error("SendBuf", "cannot send buffer");
4848  return -1;
4849  }
4850  }
4851  return length;
4852 }
4853 
4854 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4855 /// Receive exactly length bytes into buffer. Use opt to receive out-of-band
4856 /// data or to have a peek at what is in the buffer (see TSocket). Buffer
4857 /// must be able to store at least length bytes. Returns the number of
4858 /// bytes received (can be 0 if other side of connection was closed) or -1
4859 /// in case of error, -2 in case of MSG_OOB and errno == EWOULDBLOCK, -3
4860 /// in case of MSG_OOB and errno == EINVAL and -4 in case of kNoBlock and
4861 /// errno == EWOULDBLOCK. Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer
4862 /// (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
4863 
4864 int TWinNTSystem::RecvRaw(int sock, void *buf, int length, int opt)
4865 {
4866  int flag;
4867 
4868  switch (opt) {
4869  case kDefault:
4870  flag = 0;
4871  break;
4872  case kOob:
4873  flag = MSG_OOB;
4874  break;
4875  case kPeek:
4876  flag = MSG_PEEK;
4877  break;
4878  case kDontBlock:
4879  flag = -1;
4880  break;
4881  default:
4882  flag = 0;
4883  break;
4884  }
4885 
4886  int n;
4887  if ((n = WinNTRecv(sock, buf, length, flag)) <= 0) {
4888  if (n == -1) {
4889  Error("RecvRaw", "cannot receive buffer");
4890  }
4891  return n;
4892  }
4893  return n;
4894 }
4895 
4896 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4897 /// Send exactly length bytes from buffer. Use opt to send out-of-band
4898 /// data (see TSocket). Returns the number of bytes sent or -1 in case of
4899 /// error. Returns -4 in case of kNoBlock and errno == EWOULDBLOCK.
4900 /// Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
4901 
4902 int TWinNTSystem::SendRaw(int sock, const void *buf, int length, int opt)
4903 {
4904  int flag;
4905 
4906  switch (opt) {
4907  case kDefault:
4908  flag = 0;
4909  break;
4910  case kOob:
4911  flag = MSG_OOB;
4912  break;
4913  case kDontBlock:
4914  flag = -1;
4915  break;
4916  case kPeek: // receive only option (see RecvRaw)
4917  default:
4918  flag = 0;
4919  break;
4920  }
4921 
4922  int n;
4923  if ((n = WinNTSend(sock, buf, length, flag)) <= 0) {
4924  if (n == -1 && GetErrno() != EINTR) {
4925  Error("SendRaw", "cannot send buffer");
4926  }
4927  return n;
4928  }
4929  return n;
4930 }

4932 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4933 /// Set socket option.
4934 
4935 int TWinNTSystem::SetSockOpt(int socket, int opt, int value)
4936 {
4937  u_long val = value;
4938  if (socket == -1) return -1;
4939  SOCKET sock = socket;
4940 
4941  switch (opt) {
4942  case kSendBuffer:
4943  if (::setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4944  ::SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_SNDBUF)");
4945  return -1;
4946  }
4947  break;
4948  case kRecvBuffer:
4949  if (::setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4950  ::SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_RCVBUF)");
4951  return -1;
4952  }
4953  break;
4954  case kOobInline:
4955  if (::setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_OOBINLINE, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4956  SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_OOBINLINE)");
4957  return -1;
4958  }
4959  break;
4960  case kKeepAlive:
4961  if (::setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4962  ::SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_KEEPALIVE)");
4963  return -1;
4964  }
4965  break;
4966  case kReuseAddr:
4967  if (::setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4968  ::SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_REUSEADDR)");
4969  return -1;
4970  }
4971  break;
4972  case kNoDelay:
4973  if (::setsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4974  ::SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(TCP_NODELAY)");
4975  return -1;
4976  }
4977  break;
4978  case kNoBlock:
4979  if (::ioctlsocket(sock, FIONBIO, &val) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
4980  ::SysError("SetSockOpt", "ioctl(FIONBIO)");
4981  return -1;
4982  }
4983  break;
4984 #if 0
4985  case kProcessGroup:
4986  if (::ioctl(sock, SIOCSPGRP, &val) == -1) {
4987  ::SysError("SetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCSPGRP)");
4988  return -1;
4989  }
4990  break;
4991 #endif
4992  case kAtMark: // read-only option (see GetSockOpt)
4993  case kBytesToRead: // read-only option
4994  default:
4995  Error("SetSockOpt", "illegal option (%d)", opt);
4996  return -1;
4997  break;
4998  }
4999  return 0;
5000 }
5001 
5002 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5003 /// Get socket option.
5004 
5005 int TWinNTSystem::GetSockOpt(int socket, int opt, int *val)
5006 {
5007  if (socket == -1) return -1;
5008  SOCKET sock = socket;
5009 
5010  int optlen = sizeof(*val);
5011 
5012  switch (opt) {
5013  case kSendBuffer:
5014  if (::getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char*)val, &optlen) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5015  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_SNDBUF)");
5016  return -1;
5017  }
5018  break;
5019  case kRecvBuffer:
5020  if (::getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char*)val, &optlen) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5021  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_RCVBUF)");
5022  return -1;
5023  }
5024  break;
5025  case kOobInline:
5026  if (::getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_OOBINLINE, (char*)val, &optlen) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5027  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_OOBINLINE)");
5028  return -1;
5029  }
5030  break;
5031  case kKeepAlive:
5032  if (::getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, (char*)val, &optlen) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5033  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_KEEPALIVE)");
5034  return -1;
5035  }
5036  break;
5037  case kReuseAddr:
5038  if (::getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char*)val, &optlen) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5039  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_REUSEADDR)");
5040  return -1;
5041  }
5042  break;
5043  case kNoDelay:
5044  if (::getsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char*)val, &optlen) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5045  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(TCP_NODELAY)");
5046  return -1;
5047  }
5048  break;
5049  case kNoBlock:
5050  {
5051  int flg = 0;
5052  if (sock == INVALID_SOCKET) {
5053  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "INVALID_SOCKET");
5054  }
5055  *val = flg; // & O_NDELAY; It is not been defined for WIN32
5056  return -1;
5057  }
5058  break;
5059 #if 0
5060  case kProcessGroup:
5061  if (::ioctlsocket(sock, SIOCGPGRP, (u_long*)val) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5062  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCGPGRP)");
5063  return -1;
5064  }
5065  break;
5066 #endif
5067  case kAtMark:
5068  if (::ioctlsocket(sock, SIOCATMARK, (u_long*)val) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5069  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCATMARK)");
5070  return -1;
5071  }
5072  break;
5073  case kBytesToRead:
5074  if (::ioctlsocket(sock, FIONREAD, (u_long*)val) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5075  ::SysError("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(FIONREAD)");
5076  return -1;
5077  }
5078  break;
5079  default:
5080  Error("GetSockOpt", "illegal option (%d)", opt);
5081  *val = 0;
5082  return -1;
5083  break;
5084  }
5085  return 0;
5086 }

5088 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5089 /// Connect to service servicename on server servername.
5090 
5091 int TWinNTSystem::ConnectService(const char *servername, int port,
5092  int tcpwindowsize, const char *protocol)
5093 {
5094  short sport;
5095  struct servent *sp;
5096 
5097  if (!strcmp(servername, "unix")) {
5098  return WinNTUnixConnect(port);
5099  }
5100  else if (!gSystem->AccessPathName(servername) || servername[0] == '/' ||
5101  (servername[1] == ':' && servername[2] == '/')) {
5102  return WinNTUnixConnect(servername);
5103  }
5104 
5105  if (!strcmp(protocol, "udp")){
5106  return WinNTUdpConnect(servername, port);
5107  }
5108 
5109  if ((sp = ::getservbyport(::htons(port), kProtocolName))) {
5110  sport = sp->s_port;
5111  } else {
5112  sport = ::htons(port);
5113  }
5114 
5115  TInetAddress addr = gSystem->GetHostByName(servername);
5116  if (!addr.IsValid()) return -1;
5117  UInt_t adr = ::htonl(addr.GetAddress());
5118 
5119  struct sockaddr_in server;
5120  memset(&server, 0, sizeof(server));
5121  memcpy(&server.sin_addr, &adr, sizeof(adr));
5122  server.sin_family = addr.GetFamily();
5123  server.sin_port = sport;
5124 
5125  // Create socket
5126  SOCKET sock;
5127  if ((sock = ::socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == INVALID_SOCKET) {
5128  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTConnectTcp", "socket");
5129  return -1;
5130  }
5131 
5132  if (tcpwindowsize > 0) {
5133  gSystem->SetSockOpt((int)sock, kRecvBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
5134  gSystem->SetSockOpt((int)sock, kSendBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
5135  }
5136 
5137  if (::connect(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &server, sizeof(server)) == INVALID_SOCKET) {
5138  //::SysError("TWinNTSystem::UnixConnectTcp", "connect");
5139  ::closesocket(sock);
5140  return -1;
5141  }
5142  return (int) sock;
5143 }
5144 
5145 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5146 /// Connect to a Unix domain socket.
5147 
5148 int TWinNTSystem::WinNTUnixConnect(int port)
5149 {
5150  struct sockaddr_in myaddr;
5151  int sock;
5152 
5153  memset(&myaddr, 0, sizeof(myaddr));
5154  myaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
5155  myaddr.sin_port = port;
5156  myaddr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_LOOPBACK);
5157 
5158  // Open socket
5159  if ((sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0) {
5160  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTUnixConnect", "socket");
5161  return -1;
5162  }
5163 
5164  while ((connect(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&myaddr, sizeof myaddr)) == -1) {
5165  if (GetErrno() == EINTR)
5166  ResetErrno();
5167  else {
5168  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTUnixConnect", "connect");
5169  close(sock);
5170  return -1;
5171  }
5172  }
5173  return sock;
5174 }
5175 
5176 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5177 /// Connect to a Unix domain socket. Returns -1 in case of error.
5178 
5179 int TWinNTSystem::WinNTUnixConnect(const char *sockpath)
5180 {
5181  FILE *fp;
5182  int port = 0;
5183 
5184  if (!sockpath || strlen(sockpath) <= 0) {
5185  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTUnixConnect", "socket path undefined");
5186  return -1;
5187  }
5188  TString socketpath = sockpath;
5189  socketpath.ReplaceAll("/", "\\");
5190  fp = fopen(socketpath.Data(), "rb");
5191  if (!fp) {
5192  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTUnixConnect", "fopen");
5193  return -1;
5194  }
5195  fscanf(fp, "%d", &port);
5196  fclose(fp);
5197  /* XXX: set errno in this case */
5198  if (port < 0 || port > 65535) {
5199  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTUnixConnect", "invalid port");
5200  return -1;
5201  }
5202  return WinNTUnixConnect(port);
5203 }
5204 
5205 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5206 /// Creates a UDP socket connection
5207 /// Is called via the TSocket constructor. Returns -1 in case of error.
5208 
5209 int TWinNTSystem::WinNTUdpConnect(const char *hostname, int port)
5210 {
5211  short sport;
5212  struct servent *sp;
5213 
5214  if ((sp = getservbyport(htons(port), kProtocolName)))
5215  sport = sp->s_port;
5216  else
5217  sport = htons(port);
5218 
5219  TInetAddress addr = gSystem->GetHostByName(hostname);
5220  if (!addr.IsValid()) return -1;
5221  UInt_t adr = htonl(addr.GetAddress());
5222 
5223  struct sockaddr_in server;
5224  memset(&server, 0, sizeof(server));
5225  memcpy(&server.sin_addr, &adr, sizeof(adr));
5226  server.sin_family = addr.GetFamily();
5227  server.sin_port = sport;
5228 
5229  // Create socket
5230  int sock;
5231  if ((sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP)) < 0) {
5232  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTUdpConnect", "socket (%s:%d)",
5233  hostname, port);
5234  return -1;
5235  }
5236 
5237  while (connect(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &server, sizeof(server)) == -1) {
5238  if (GetErrno() == EINTR)
5239  ResetErrno();
5240  else {
5241  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTUdpConnect", "connect (%s:%d)",
5242  hostname, port);
5243  close(sock);
5244  return -1;
5245  }
5246  }
5247  return sock;
5248 }

5250 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5251 /// Open a connection to a service on a server. Returns -1 in case
5252 /// connection cannot be opened.
5253 /// Use tcpwindowsize to specify the size of the receive buffer, it has
5254 /// to be specified here to make sure the window scale option is set (for
5255 /// tcpwindowsize > 65KB and for platforms supporting window scaling).
5256 /// Is called via the TSocket constructor.
5257 
5258 int TWinNTSystem::OpenConnection(const char *server, int port, int tcpwindowsize,
5259  const char *protocol)
5260 {
5261  return ConnectService(server, port, tcpwindowsize, protocol);
5262 }
5263 
5264 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5265 /// Announce TCP/IP service.
5266 /// Open a socket, bind to it and start listening for TCP/IP connections
5267 /// on the port. If reuse is true reuse the address, backlog specifies
5268 /// how many sockets can be waiting to be accepted.
5269 /// Use tcpwindowsize to specify the size of the receive buffer, it has
5270 /// to be specified here to make sure the window scale option is set (for
5271 /// tcpwindowsize > 65KB and for platforms supporting window scaling).
5272 /// Returns socket fd or -1 if socket() failed, -2 if bind() failed
5273 /// or -3 if listen() failed.
5274 
5275 int TWinNTSystem::AnnounceTcpService(int port, Bool_t reuse, int backlog,
5276  int tcpwindowsize)
5277 {
5278  short sport;
5279  struct servent *sp;
5280  const short kSOCKET_MINPORT = 5000, kSOCKET_MAXPORT = 15000;
5281  short tryport = kSOCKET_MINPORT;
5282 
5283  if ((sp = ::getservbyport(::htons(port), kProtocolName))) {
5284  sport = sp->s_port;
5285  } else {
5286  sport = ::htons(port);
5287  }
5288 
5289  if (port == 0 && reuse) {
5290  ::Error("TWinNTSystem::WinNTTcpService", "cannot do a port scan while reuse is true");
5291  return -1;
5292  }
5293 
5294  if ((sp = ::getservbyport(::htons(port), kProtocolName))) {
5295  sport = sp->s_port;
5296  } else {
5297  sport = ::htons(port);
5298  }
5299 
5300  // Create tcp socket
5301  SOCKET sock;
5302  if ((sock = ::socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0) {
5303  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTTcpService", "socket");
5304  return -1;
5305  }
5306 
5307  if (reuse) {
5308  gSystem->SetSockOpt((int)sock, kReuseAddr, 1);
5309  }
5310 
5311  if (tcpwindowsize > 0) {
5312  gSystem->SetSockOpt((int)sock, kRecvBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
5313  gSystem->SetSockOpt((int)sock, kSendBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
5314  }
5315 
5316  struct sockaddr_in inserver;
5317  memset(&inserver, 0, sizeof(inserver));
5318  inserver.sin_family = AF_INET;
5319  inserver.sin_addr.s_addr = ::htonl(INADDR_ANY);
5320  inserver.sin_port = sport;
5321 
5322  // Bind socket
5323  if (port > 0) {
5324  if (::bind(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &inserver, sizeof(inserver)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5325  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTTcpService", "bind");
5326  return -2;
5327  }
5328  } else {
5329  int bret;
5330  do {
5331  inserver.sin_port = ::htons(tryport);
5332  bret = ::bind(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &inserver, sizeof(inserver));
5333  tryport++;
5334  } while (bret == SOCKET_ERROR && WSAGetLastError() == WSAEADDRINUSE &&
5335  tryport < kSOCKET_MAXPORT);
5336  if (bret == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5337  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTTcpService", "bind (port scan)");
5338  return -2;
5339  }
5340  }
5341 
5342  // Start accepting connections
5343  if (::listen(sock, backlog) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
5344  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::WinNTTcpService", "listen");
5345  return -3;
5346  }
5347  return (int)sock;
5348 }
5349 
5350 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5351 /// Announce UDP service.
5352 
5353 int TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUdpService(int port, int backlog)
5354 {
5355  // Open a socket, bind to it and start listening for UDP connections
5356  // on the port. If reuse is true reuse the address, backlog specifies
5357  // how many sockets can be waiting to be accepted. If port is 0 a port
5358  // scan will be done to find a free port. This option is mutual exlusive
5359  // with the reuse option.
5360 
5361  const short kSOCKET_MINPORT = 5000, kSOCKET_MAXPORT = 15000;
5362  short sport, tryport = kSOCKET_MINPORT;
5363  struct servent *sp;
5364 
5365  if ((sp = getservbyport(htons(port), kProtocolName)))
5366  sport = sp->s_port;
5367  else
5368  sport = htons(port);
5369 
5370  // Create udp socket
5371  int sock;
5372  if ((sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP)) < 0) {
5373  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixUdpService", "socket");
5374  return -1;
5375  }
5376 
5377  struct sockaddr_in inserver;
5378  memset(&inserver, 0, sizeof(inserver));
5379  inserver.sin_family = AF_INET;
5380  inserver.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
5381  inserver.sin_port = sport;
5382 
5383  // Bind socket
5384  if (port > 0) {
5385  if (bind(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &inserver, sizeof(inserver))) {
5386  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUdpService", "bind");
5387  return -2;
5388  }
5389  } else {
5390  int bret;
5391  do {
5392  inserver.sin_port = htons(tryport);
5393  bret = bind(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &inserver, sizeof(inserver));
5394  tryport++;
5395  } while (bret == SOCKET_ERROR && WSAGetLastError() == WSAEADDRINUSE &&
5396  tryport < kSOCKET_MAXPORT);
5397  if (bret < 0) {
5398  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUdpService", "bind (port scan)");
5399  return -2;
5400  }
5401  }
5402 
5403  // Start accepting connections
5404  if (listen(sock, backlog)) {
5405  ::SysError("TWinNTSystem::AnnounceUdpService", "listen");
5406  return -3;
5407  }
5408 
5409  return sock;
5410 }
5411 
5412 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5413 /// Accept a connection. In case of an error return -1. In case
5414 /// non-blocking I/O is enabled and no connections are available
5415 /// return -2.
5416 
5417 int TWinNTSystem::AcceptConnection(int socket)
5418 {
5419  int soc = -1;
5420  SOCKET sock = socket;
5421 
5422  while ((soc = ::accept(sock, 0, 0)) == INVALID_SOCKET &&
5423  (::WSAGetLastError() == WSAEINTR)) {
5424  TSystem::ResetErrno();
5425  }
5426 
5427  if (soc == -1) {
5428  if (::WSAGetLastError() == WSAEWOULDBLOCK) {
5429  return -2;
5430  } else {
5431  ::SysError("AcceptConnection", "accept");
5432  return -1;
5433  }
5434  }
5435  return soc;
5436 }

5485 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5486 /// Calculate the CPU clock speed using the 'rdtsc' instruction.
5487 /// RDTSC: Read Time Stamp Counter.
5488 
5489 static DWORD GetCPUSpeed()
5490 {
5491  LARGE_INTEGER ulFreq, ulTicks, ulValue, ulStartCounter;
5492 
5493  // Query for high-resolution counter frequency
5494  // (this is not the CPU frequency):
5495  if (QueryPerformanceFrequency(&ulFreq)) {
5496  // Query current value:
5497  QueryPerformanceCounter(&ulTicks);
5498  // Calculate end value (one second interval);
5499  // this is (current + frequency)
5500  ulValue.QuadPart = ulTicks.QuadPart + ulFreq.QuadPart/10;
5501  ulStartCounter.QuadPart = __rdtsc();
5502 
5503  // Loop for one second (measured with the high-resolution counter):
5504  do {
5505  QueryPerformanceCounter(&ulTicks);
5506  } while (ulTicks.QuadPart <= ulValue.QuadPart);
5507  // Now again read CPU time-stamp counter:
5508  return (DWORD)((__rdtsc() - ulStartCounter.QuadPart)/100000);
5509  } else {
5510  // No high-resolution counter present:
5511  return 0;
5512  }
5513 }
